SEURAT'S PAINTING "SUNDAY AFTERNOON ON THE ISLAND OF LA
ON THE HOLE BLASTED IN WALL

ANIMATED IN THE STYLE OF BATMAN BEYOND 3
THE MAP OF THE BLUE MONKEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy sits at a large conference table headed by MR. WARNER and MR. WARNER'S BROTHER. The end of the table is crammed with identical JUNIOR EXECUTIVES, on chairs that put their heads only halfway above the lip of the table.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Wait. There’s a love story...

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: (perplexed) You killed Elmer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER'S BROTHER
dialogues.text: You can’t kill Elmer.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: He comes back from the dead later. Scar-faced and even more insane.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: I don’t want to play a crazy clown. I’m afraid of clowns.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s up, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS BUNNY
dialogues.text: stands at the doorway to the conference room, dramatically backlit.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: All the Junior Executives at the table LAUGH UPROARIOUSLY. Daffy looks steamed.

dialogues.speaker: ON BUGS
dialogues.text: As he strolls to his seat, he gestures to executives in their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Colin, saw the piece in Variety. Mr. Big Shot... Hey, Kyle. Day twenty-three, right?... Jerry J.! Bugs play boxes with an executive affectionately, then turns to another executive, very concerned.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (very sincere) Ian, if your sister needs anymore bone marrow, I’m there. Bugs sits down and turns to Daffy. BUGS (CONT’D) So Daf, I was reading this rewrite you did and I only got one question. Where’s me?

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (eye roll) Actors. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH es + eH  2a.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (patronizing) I was getting to your part, Bugsy.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED IN THE STYLE OF BATMAN BEYOND 3
dialogues.text: As the calliope explodes from several angles, we PAN DOWN to street level. A manhole cover opens and a particularly dumb-looking Bugs emerges, chomping a carrot.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Duh... what’s up, Doc? The carrot is revealed to have a fast-burning fuse. It EXPLODES. A charred Bugs looks stupefied. Then a huge, flaming chunk of calliope lands on his head.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 4
dialogues.text: Bugs rises, nonchalant, readying his exit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Fine with me. The money all goes to the wives anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (smug, victorious) We’ll invite you to the premiere!

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I’m sorry. This is KATE. She speaks quickly, confidently, as if she doesn’t need anything or anybody, but we all know better.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think we can have a Bugs Bunny movie without Bugs Bunny.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: A Bugs Bunny movie without Bugs Bunny? Whoever heard of such a thing? MR. WARNER’S BROTHER I think we just did. Daffy paces down the table, acting thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Oh my, heavens no. You couldn’t have a movie without Bugs Bunny. Riots in the streets. The fall of western civilization. It'd be like meatless meat. Creme without brulee. Daffy winds up standing on the table in Kate’s face. DAFFY (CONT’D) (very condescending) Say, if you don’t mind my asking, whose assistant are you? Kate grabs Daffy’s hand and squeezes it. His head expands.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Kate Houghton. Executive Vice President. (dead serious) Comedy . He HHH HH OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH +e * HF (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Kate releases Daffy’s hand, Daffy’s head deflates to slightly less than normal accompanied by the HIGH SQUEAK OF A LEAKING BALLOON.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic) Kate did “Lethal Weapon Babies.” He points to a poster similar to a “Lethal Weapon” poster, only Danny Glover and Mel Gibson are airbrushed babies (not cartoons). The catchphrase is “Nap Time's Over.” The movie is rated PG-17. MR. WARNER’S BROTHER Finally, a “Lethal Weapon” I can take my grandchildren to.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: We’ve brought Kate in because we think she can really add something to the Loopy Tunes mix. We see Daffy making a quick calculation in his head and then suddenly turn to Kate, sucking up desperately.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Fresh perspective, just what we need -- new ideas for a post-Bugs-— Bunny world. Kate pulls out her extremely cool Sprint computer/phone and calls up a bunch of charts and graphs on it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a +e % + eH + eH

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Actually, our latest research shows that Bugs Bunny is a core asset that appeals to male and female, young and old, throughout the known universe... We cut to Bugs. He is busily cleaning himself, licking his paw and rubbing it over his face.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-while your fanbase is limited to angry fat guys in basements. And there’s only seven of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Did you count Ted?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (checking phone) Yes. Daffy SWALLOWS nervously. He turns to the Warner Brothers, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: C‘mmmmmmon, fellas! I'm thrice the entertainer the rabbit is!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: <casual belch> The room bursts into LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (dryly) | Yes, he’s hilarious. But moviegoers these days demand action! Daffy launches into a kung fu routine:

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hah! Ho! Ah-cha-cha! Daffy executes a flurry of judo-like moves, resulting in his arm being stuck in his ear up to his elbow (his hand protrudes from the opposite ear.) Daffy extracts his hand and shakes goo off it.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Top that, rabbit! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugs gracefully assumes an elaborate karate pose.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (perfectly poised) Kong Que (Kong KYU-yu-ah). “The Peacock.” He lightly flicks the back of Daffy’s head with his toe. Daffy’s EYES POP OUT and bounce around on the table.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS EXECUTIVES
dialogues.text: Ooh/ Aah/ Etc. Daffy blindly swipes at the awkwardly bouncing eyes (which watch with alarm). Bugs throws some jacks down on the table and starts picking them up as the eyes bounce. Daffy angrily catches his eyes, then shoves the eyes up close to Bugs’ face. They squint.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Despicable.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You can’t have his eyeballs falling out like that. It makes people think of their own eyeballs falling out. Shoving his eyes back in, Daffy takes his stand.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: So,it has come to this. I'm afraid the brothers Warner must choose between a handsome matinee idol, or... We cut back to Bugs. He is offering his finger to an executive, happily. The executive tentatively pulls it. Confetti flies out of Bugs’ ears.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...this miscreant perpetrator of low burlesque!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (arbitrating) Look, I don’t think it has to be one or--

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: (quickly) Miscreant perpetrator of low burlesque. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH + eH  5A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MR. WARNER’S BROTHER Whichever one’s not the duck. Mr. Warner reaches down, and picks up a cardboard box containing assorted pictures and stuffed Daffys, etc. (a black-and-white picture of Daffy with Nixon, six-pound barbell, one of those executive clacky-ball things, a bottle of Chambord).

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: Here’s the stuff from your office. Bugs starts casually picking through the stuff. Daffy is stunned. Kate appears, confused.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (clarifying) You're firing Daffy Duck?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: Oh no, we’re not firing Daffy Duck. MR. WARNER’S BROTHER You are.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (accepting decision) Okay. She turns to Daffy, businesslike and starts leading him out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry it had to come to this. I really like your work. Huge fan. That whole... (does Donald Duck) Kate starts to lead Daffy out. He turns back toward the Warner Brothers, spouting tears, even as Kate continues to move him toward the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF FF *

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Wait!! I unquit! I de-resign! I take it all baaa-ack!!! Bugs appears, holding a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: How you can take back this vicious letter of resignation?

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I didn’t write any- (starts to read) “never in all my life”... sounds like me... “incompetent nincompoopery”... wow, I sure know how to burn my bridges...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let me walk you out. As they walk out...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Look, I’m gonna try to keep this out of the trades.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OUTSIDE BUILDING
dialogues.text: (yelling) Daffy’s been fired!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FURTHER AWAY
dialogues.text: (yelling) Execs axe quack hack!  EXT. WARNER BROS LOT — DAY DJ, a strapping, handsome fellow, stands guard. Kate walks up gripping Daffy’s forearm as he squirms like a little kid. Bugs strolls on her other side.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I need you to eject this duck.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: This duck? This is Daffy Duck.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not anymore. We own the name.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (To Daffy, helpfully) I got the rights to Goofy Goose. You can use that till you get back on your feet.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (indignant) They can’t stop me from calling myself D- He chokes on it. The name won’t come out.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You fired Daffy Duck?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, that isn’t-- Well, I did, but only because they--

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (understanding) Just following orders.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (gets his drift) I’m having a bad enough day.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: It must be hard on the soul to become something you hate in order to keep a job you’re not even sure you want.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You tell her, sister. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eee eH OF

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (admiring) Man, it’s like you read her back story.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Please. Both of you. Shut up. Bugs and Daffy are suddenly wearing Buster Keaton and Charlie Chaplin outfits. They overdramatically “zip” their lips in unison. And, oh yes, they’re animated in black and white.

dialogues.speaker: SILENT MOVIE ART CARD
dialogues.text: “Yes, ma’am!” Kate turns to DJ. She looks Beat. He

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (defensive) You don’t know me.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Kate Houghton. Drives a red 1989 Alpha Romeo Graduate. Good engine, but under-driven. (beat; off Kate’s look) You drive past me every day. Of course, why would you notice, I’m just the security guard. at him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (coolly) You don’t know me. looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You still want me to eject the duck?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (getting pissed) Uh, yeah. Is that going to be difficult for you?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: A little. You let him escape. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eK * ee HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eS

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate looks down. Her hand is empty. Daffy is, indeed, gone. Flustered, she lashes out at D.J.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) What do you do now? Call for backup? DJ looks around for Daffy. Suddenly Daffy zips in behind him, runs up his back, and stands on his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I went that a-away! Daffy runs down and over DJ’s face and zips off in the direction he pointed. Now pissed, DJ gives chase. Kate and Bugs walk off.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How does Snooty’s sound for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS/DAFFY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A little pretentious.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 6
dialogues.text: EXT. BACKLOT —- CONTINUOUS 7 DJ chases Daffy in and around various stagehands who are carrying or carting props that will appear later in the movie. There are also costumed actors we will see later.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Stop! Or I’1l write a report! A giant stone monkey head is being hoisted by a crane. Daffy jumps into the cab, surprising the operator. He pulls a lever. The giant stone monkey head drops. DJ catches it and hands it to a stagehand. Daffy takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy scurries up a ladder propped against the back of a particularly cheap-looking building flat. He quickly pulls up the ladder after him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ arrives as Daffy disappears through a window on the flat. Seeing there’s no ladder, DJ leaps up onto the flat and begins scaling the wood supports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ climbs out the window Daffy escaped through. We now see he is on the ledge of a dark, Gothic building. It’s surprisingly realistic looking for a “flat.” Also on the ledge next to him is BATMAN, who throws his hands up, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: BIG HOLLYWOOD DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cut! Cut! DJ turns to the voice, loses his footing and falls. We see on the ground there is a giant airbag. DJ falls just beyond the airbag, hitting the ground hard. He pops back up a second later.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I’m okay!

dialogues.speaker: BIG HOLLYWOOD DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Who cares? DJ is about to respond when he sees: Daffy hops into the BATMOBILE. Angry PAs come at DJ. He flicks them off like flies.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BATMOBILE
dialogues.text: Daffy grabs the controls.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: To the duckcave! A hand grabs him by the throat. EXT. BACKLOT —- CONTINUOUS 9A DJ, carrying Daffy by the neck, walks away from the Batmobile, toward camera. He does not see the flames shoot from the back of the Batmobile. But Daffy does.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: So, feeling pretty good about yourself? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I am. In the b.g., the Batmobile starts to move.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You bested that dastardly duck.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I did. The Batmobile is moving pretty fast now. Folks start to run after it. Daffy is watching all this.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: And now you're going to offer your catch to the pretty executive...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Indeed. In the b.g., the Batmobile crashes into the Warner Brothers water tower, knocking one of its supports completely clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate drives Bugs in her Cabriolet convertible.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: If Daffy’s not careful, he’s gonna end up on Saturday morning, wearing a diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Kate turns and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ stands and proudly holds Daffy aloft. Right behind him, though, the water tower is toppling over and coming right at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water tower spills a wall of water onto Kate and Bugs. DJ and Daffy escape injury when the legs of the tower land on either side of them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CAR
dialogues.text: Kate sputters, neck deep in water. Bugs floats in an inflatable ring, wearing sunglasses, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: This is why I hate driving in L.A. A furious Kate glares at DJ holding Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (to DJ) I think she likes you.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 12A-C
dialogues.text: EXT. WARNER BROTHERS’ GATE - DAY 13 DJ, stripped of his guard shirt (he wears a muscle T), flies out the gate, does a midair somersault and lands on his feet. Just as he straightens up, Daffy flies out from the gate and onto the back of DJ’s head. DJ turns around but Daffy remains in place; he’s now wrapped around DJ’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Let me get off your face there.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Yes. That would be lovely. Daffy climbs down. He gestures inside the gate, where there is much commotion and destruction.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ooh. I better give them a couple hours to cool off. (to DJ) So, where for lunch? I’m banned at the following restaurants: Spago, Orso, Der Wienerschnitzel...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Go away. DJ is unlocking a dubiously street legal motorbike from a nearby pole. Daffy walks up.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Hey, what gives? We’ve shared. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: And it was a delight. But now I must move on with my life, which, it saddens me to report, will not include any insane ducks...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You sir, are a snob! A specie-ist! DJ, now on the bike, pops a wheelie, twirls the bike around once on its back wheel, and speeds off frame. Oddly, this kicks much smoke and dust into Daffy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (coughing, calling) You just bought yourself a lawsuit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS WARNER BROTHERS STARS lunch casually with Time- Warner CARTOON CELEBRITIES of their choice. We PAN across a couple of tables. In the first, PORKY PIG complains to his SYMPATHETIC CELEBRITY FRIEND.

dialogues.speaker: PORKY
dialogues.text: (sans stutter) They tell me, lose the speech impediment, it’s not politically correct. So I lose the speech impediment. Now they tell me I’m not funny! In the second, a traditionally animated SHAGGY and SCOOBY DOO are talking to MATTHEW LILLARD, playing himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: You, like, made me sound like a, like, total space cadet.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW LILLARD
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you feel that way. I tried to be true to your character. Shaggy leans over the booth aggressively. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: If you, like, goof on me in the sequel, I’m coming after you! Scooby gets into Matthew Lillard’s face, GROWLING very, very realistically. Matthew does a scared Shaggy take. Bugs and Kate are at the third table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Some areas of the script I think we need to address: there’s no heart, no one’s cooperating, nobody learns anything...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Daffy learns not to stick his head in a jet engine.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t you know? Daffy always comes back. I just tell him how much I need him. We hug. We cry. I drop something heavy on him. I laugh. Kate produces her cellphone and makes a few quick motions with the stylus.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He’s deleted. We need to move on.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: You'll go far in this business.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I already have. The question is, how can I help you reposition your brand identity? Answer: team you up with a hot female co-star!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I don’t think I’d feel right about dropping heavy things on a girl...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We change the dynamic. You still can’t stand each other, but now you fall madly in love...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Usually I play the female love interest. Bugs whips on a crimson gown and platinum wig.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: About the cross-dressing. In the past, funny. Today, disturbing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bugs smacks his ruby lips at Kate sexily. She winces.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I can’t reinvigorate you if you won’t play ball with me... A baseball plops into Kate’s drink, splashing her. Bugs sits across from her in a baseball uniform, pounding his fist into a glove and chawing on something. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not funny.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: We disagree.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let’s change the subject. Here, you'll love this. The consumer products people visualized some concepts for your new look. Kate produces a sketch of Bugs wearing baggy lowriders, half shirt and Rasta cap.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Urban suburban. Urban look, but roomier in the waist. Kate looks to Bugs for affirmation. His stares back icily, with, of course, ice hanging off his face.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: No offense, sweetcakes, but I like my look, and for that matter, he may get on my nerves, and he takes money from my wallet, but when it comes to sidekicks...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (putting foot down) Stop. Listen. I’m trying to be nice, but I was brought in to leverage your synergy, and I’m not going to let you or some wacky duck—

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wacky, Daffy, Nutty, Fruitcake Duck, it doesn’t matter, the mental health groups are going to line us up and shoot us! Bugs wears a blindfold and French beret, an unlit cigarette in his lips. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH OK

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (French accent) Tell Gigi, Fifi, Cece and Zuzu I love them. Kate, in a complete panic, reaches over and knocks the cigarette out of Bugs’ mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You can’t smoke! Kids are watching! Kate points. Sitting on the floor is RALPH PHILLIPS and his FRIEND, staring up at them as if it’s TV.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I want to smoke what Bugs smokes.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: If Bugs Bunny jumped off a cliff, would you jump off a cliff?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I sure would. Kate is completely flummoxed. She steels herself; it looks like she’s going to have to pull rank.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: As the executive on this project, I have to insist that we do every single thing I say.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: As the recipient of these... He places five Oscar-like statues on the table. He then hoists up his Hollywood Walk of Fame star, which he has apparently jack-hammered out of the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -..and this, I insist we do things like we've always done them, which includes getting Daffy back.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY DUCKISH VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m back, Bugsy! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's JAMIE KENNEDY , in a cheap duck costume.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (pitching) Can you believe it? We got Jamie Kennedy! Bugs gets up. He stares at Kate calmly.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Of course you realize: this means war. Bugs exits. Kate calls after him angrily.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We own that catchphrase! Kate sighs deeply, frustrated and upset. Suddenly, a huge black duck tail is shoved in her face.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Could you be a doll and scratch that for me? As Kate makes a face, we pan over to another table where MARTIN SHEEN is talking to a Max Fleisher-style SUPERMAN.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN SHEEN
dialogues.text: There’s a couple of Republicans in the Senate who need a little timeout in the fortress of solitude, if you catch my drift...

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: You realize you’re not actually the president, right? The camera continues panning. EXT. DRAKE HOUSE — AFTERNOON 16 A fancy English Tudor. DJ rides up on his motorbike.

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Little Damian! GRANNY is clipping the hedges next door. TWEETY is ina cage on a stand next to her. The top of Sylvester’s head can be viewed eying Tweety. DJ waves back, smiling warmly but wearily. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hey, Granny! Tweety!

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: How was your first day at work?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Eventful. DJ goes in the house.

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY
dialogues.text: I didn’t plant cat tails. Granny lops off Sylvester’s tail, which was hovering there. Sylvester drops out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ enters the house. He shuts the door and sighs deeply. There is the sudden sound of his gym bag UNZIPPING. Daffy climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Look, it’s your old friend, Daffy Duck. Daffy sticks out his tongue and gives DJ a great big Wet Willy (tongue in ear).

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hey, how...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Don't think about it for too long; it'll just mess with your head. Daffy strolls around the place, touching everything, turning stuff over, shaking it, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice place. (sniffs) What have you got, a goat?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Did I miss the part where I invited you in? Daffy places his hand on a neat stack of magazines and spreads them haphazardly across the table. He glances at the covers. Bugs is on every one. Daffy snorts.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Liberal media bias. Daffy picks up a Hollywood Reporter, which somehow managed to get printed, delivered and end up in a pile of read magazines in a house.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, no such thing as bad... (noticing something) Qooo...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Perhaps I was being too polite. Get out. Daffy turns casually away.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I’m going. I’m going.

dialogues.speaker: ON AQUARIUM
dialogues.text: Daffy looks into the aquarium with seemingly academic interest.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ah, an ichthyologium. Suddenly, Daffy shoves his hand into the aquarium, plucks out a large tropical fish and pops it into his mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH  15A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ runs up, grabs Daffy, and sticks his hand down Daffy’s throat. He pulls out a donut.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (scolding) Personal space! He reaches back down Daffy’s throat, pulls out the fish, and puts it back into the tank. Over this, Daffy complains.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, I was digesting that!

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Daffy...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (strangled voice) Speaking.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Leave my father’s house, now. DJ squishes Daffy down.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Now you’ve got a lawsuit on your hands. Daffy springs up and jumps onto the piano stool. (Note: let’s not do the piano bit that’s here. It really hurts the continuity.)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. You live with your father?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Kinda, sorta... Daffy drops off the table, rolling and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (laughing) That’s rich! As he laughs, Daffy pounds on the piano keys with his fists. He continues laughing, pounding his fists on top of the piano as he crawls up onto it. His fist stops in mid-pound when he sees all the posters on the wall. Then he stops laughing abruptly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  15B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Framed posters on the wall for James Bond-type movies: "ICE SPIES”, "TO LIVE INSTEAD OF DIE" and “SCAR CAUSER.” The name "Damian Drake" features prominently over a Timothy Dalton type. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in hushed awe) Your dad’s Damian Drake, the super spy?

dialogues.speaker: DI
dialogues.text: (been here before) He’s an actor. Who plays a spy. Daffy knocks an award off a plaque.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that, that was his “I Spy” Award.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (correcting) Ingenious. An actor who plays a super spy as a cover for being a super spy playing an actor! I'll bet this whole dump’s a super spy lair! Nothing is as it seems. As he’s talking, Daffy is looking around with the magnifying glass. He looks towards the audience and we see his eye in the magnifying glass. On the word “lair” he pulls the magnifying glass away from his face, but there is still an eye in the glass that continues looking around as he says, “Nothing is as it seems.”

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You spend a lot of time on the Internet, don’t you? DJ walks away. Daffy is already at the tray, closely examining items on it.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You know, you’re probably protected by an invisible force field right this minute. Daffy picks an apple from a fruit bowl and throws it. The apple hits DJ in the face.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: ow!

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (confidently) Force-field-penetrating apple.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Feel free to continue your delusional ranting while I answer my... We cut to the strange, futuristic remote control.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-Remote? (Note: Daffy should not be seen or heard in this section.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV remote is indeed ringing. DJ picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hello? He presses the button. Instead of the TV turning on, a projector pops out of an old radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The projector projects an image onto the painting. The painting dissolves into a view screen. It's Damian DRAKE, looking straight into camera. He looks intense.

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: Son?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Dad, why are you in the painting? (NOTE: Let’s cut the “if you’re not sitting down, sit down” dialogue. It couldn’t be more cliche.)

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: Listen, DJ. I wanted to leave you out of this, but there’s no one else I can trust. Can you hold on a second? Damian’s face drops off the TV screen and we briefly see a thug approaching camera. In the foreground of the camera we see a fist form. The camera-fist ZOOM IN to the face of the thug. Damian’s face comes back into view.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Are you shooting a movie or something? Daffy zips up next to DJ, lugging a giant sandwich. He says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: Come to Las Vegas. Damian pauses to punch a bad guy.

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ask Dusty Tails about the Blue Monkey. (NOTE: Damien Drake has a lot of extraneous dialogue in this run. If it hasn’t been shot already, please delete it because it just slows everything down and is clunky besides.) Daffy bites a big hunk off his sandwich, chewing eagerly as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Blue Monkey?

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: It’s a diamond. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Daffy freezes with the sandwich in his mouth. His eyes dilate and saliva pours out of his mouth all over the sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PAINTING
dialogues.text: A fist comes into frame, punching Damian’s head o.s. There’s a flurry of feet and arms on screen. Damian, a little bloodied, appears back on screen.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Dad, are you okay? Should I call the police? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: No police. Son, I’m sorry I didn’t tell you this before, but— A huge hand grabs Damian’s face from behind. Several parts of BAD GUYS swarm in. It’s a dark blur.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Dad? Tell me what before? Dad? The blank canvas scrolls up and a different painting fills the frame. DJ is in shock. Behind him, Daffy is ranting joyously. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Diamond?! I'm rich! Filthily so! I've joined the leisure class! DAFFY’S RICH FANTASY TO BE WRITTEN. It will be on the longish side. At the end of the fantasy, we go to the classic “That’s All, Folks” rings.

dialogues.speaker: OUT OF FANTASY
dialogues.text: We pull out of the rings to reveal that they are Daffy’s pupils. We pull out further to reveal that next to Daffy is a very concerned DJ. DJ, still in shock, gets up and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: DI
dialogues.text: I gotta go save my dad...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ walks through the house, concerned. He enters the foyer and Daffy zips in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Spies and diamonds and sexy dames no doubt! DJ steps over Daffy to get his coat.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a job for: Daffy “produces” a tuxedo from behind the coat rack and throws it on.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a la Sean Connery) Duck. Daff Duck. DJ ignores this and walks toward the garage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (all business) Okay, first stop, Vegas. Should we jet or copter in? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (mostly to self) I’m just going to take my Dad’s old car...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: A superspy car? Let’s roll!

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 20
dialogues.text: 21 INT. DAMIAN DRAKE’S GARAGE — A MINUTE LATER 21 It’s pretty dark. DJ pushes the garage door button.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: This isn’t a spy car. As the door opens, we see the car is a 1974 Gremlin.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Don’t be ridiculous. Your dad’s a spy; ipso ergo, spy car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I used to deliver pizzas in this car. DJ gets in the car. Daffy is already there, propless.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Secret pizzas? DJ grabs Daffy and throws him out the driver side window. DJ rolls up the window quickly, catching Daffy’s bill in the very top. The very end of Daffy’s bill speaks.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Very high) Spy car. DJ starts the Gremlin. He pushes Daffy’s bill out window with his finger. He drives out of the garage. (NOTE: Should probably cheat it -- not see Daffy in the garage as he drives out.) EXT. DRAKE HOUSE — CONTINUOUS As the Gremlin goes down the driveway onto the street, Daffy suddenly pops up in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY DUCK, (SOME 0.S.)
dialogues.text: You know how you know it’s a spy car? Because it doesn’t look like a spy car. The Gremlin drives o.s. As the garage door closes, the floor flips over (a la “The Green Hornet”) REVEALING A SLEEK SILVER SPY CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWL JOLSON is on stage, as JAY LENO watches, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: OWL JOLSON
dialogues.text: (singing) I WANNA SINGA/ I WANNA DANCE-A... PULL BACK to reveal that we are watching this on a monitor in: INT. THE TONIGHT SHOW - GREEN ROOM — DAY 23 Bugs is talking to a SUPER HOT CHICK. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: You were a bunny? What a coincidink! Bugs's cell phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Eh, what's up, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy is in the Gremlin, gloating.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Daffy?

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Just a friendly call to tell you what you can do with your precious Hollywood dreams. For, as it so happens, while you’re pretending to star in an action movie, I’m starring in my own action reality! Me and my sidekick DJ are on our way to Vegas to score the Blue Monkey, a huge diamond which, might I add, will enable me to buy my own movie studio, where I will thereafter write, produce and direct Daffy Duck-filled Bugs- Bunny-free entertainment, for which I believe the public is clamoring!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Daff, listen... Bugs produces an index card, which he reads from.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’ve had our differences, but you're my partner and I need you.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ha! Do you hear my laughter? Ha! I repeat, for your delicatation: Ha! Daffy hangs up triumphantly. DJ casually grabs Daffy and tosses him out the window. INT. THE TONIGHT SHOW — GREEN ROOM — CONTINUOUS 25 Bugs stares at the receiver in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Blue monkey? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHOOSH. The CAMERA dives into the handset and into black.  26 27 28 29 30 23.

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK SCREEN 26
dialogues.text: A WAVEFORM flickers as the words “Blue Monkey” ECHO. PULL BACK to reveal other WAVEFORMS, and other spectral voices saying things like “Blue Moon,” “Ooh, money,” “Blue Only,” “Blooming peonies” and “Do the monkey.” A huge map of the world flickers with waveforms. An ALERT SOUND. A waveform on the West Coast flashes red. INT. HIGH-TECH COMMUNICATIONS ROOM — CONTINUOUS 27 A huge figure looks up from a book. The monitor zooms in on the red waveform: North America, West Coast, Los Angeles area, where we see a single waveform connecting a position in Beverly Hills to one in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (filtered) Me and my sidekick DJ are on our way to Vegas to score the Blue Monkey. The figure closes his book: “PAIN AND ITS CREATION.” He stands. This is MR. SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on a distinctive corporate building. INT. ACME HEADQUARTERS - HALLWAY — MOMENTS LATER 29 Mr. Smith walks past a mix of human beings and cartoons, all bustling happily. As he passes open rooms, we see animated characters testing various ACME products. At the end of the corridor, Mr. Smith takes a worn time card from a battered rack, sticks it in a verdigris- speckled time clock and pulls a lever to punch it. He puts it in a rack on the far side of the clock and a door slides open. He enters. Exiting is SAM SHEEPDOG, who clocks out. INT. ACME BUILDING — BOARDROOM — DAY 30 Presiding at the acme of the dais is MR. CHAIRMAN. He is petting a CAIMAN in his lap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: That is unacceptable! We cannot have nine-year-old children working in sweatshops making Acme sneakers! Not when three-year-olds eat so much less!

dialogues.speaker: V.P., CHILD LABOR
dialogues.text: But they require naps.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (ominously) Not if they want their porridge. Mr. Chairman reaches down.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE DAIS
dialogues.text: Is a large aquarium cage filled with cartoon insects. Mr. Chairman’s hand reaches in and plucks an insect.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman holds the insect (one of the space villians from “Space Jam”) above the caiman. He drops the insect and the caiman gobbles him greedily.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next order of business? Mr. Smith pops up next to Mr. Chairman. Mr. Smith leans over and whispers something. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) Thank you, Mr. Smith. (to the board) Grave news, my friends. Mr. Chairman picks up one of several remotes on his console. He hits a button and a floating video screen descends in front of the dais. The video screen is blue and says in the upper corner, “GAME ONE.”

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (annoyed sound) Who’s been playing with this thing? (pushing buttons) TV. Video. TV. Video. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The blue screen reads, “VIDEO 2”, “VIDEO 3”, “AUX”, and finally a picture appears on the screen: it begins as a satellite picture of the Mojave desert, but ZOOMS IN to a car on Highway 15, and finally on the Gremlin. Mr. Chairman continues as if he hadn’t been interrupted by this bit of business. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) It appears as if Damian Drake’s son knows about the Blue Monkey and is on his way to Las Vegas. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) He must not learn the location of the diamond before we do. Mr. Chairman pushes a button on the remote. First, the image he is watching breaks up into nine separate screens. He’s annoyed. He pushes another button and we briefly see a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA SHOT looking down into a (empty) bathroom stall. This image is replaced by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A barren room. Damian is strapped into a folding chair. Two INTERROGATORS come at him. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) How’s the interrogation coming? Just then Damian rears back and kicks both of the interrogators square in the face. One of them staggers to his feet and talks directly to the security camera.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR
dialogues.text: He’s about to crack. In the b.g., Damian headbutts the other interrogator. An annoyed Mr. Chairman clicks a button.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO SCREEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (loud, sung) COME AND KNOCK ON MY DOOR... Exasperated, he pushes another button and the video screen returns to showing the Gremlin with DJ driving.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (building intensity) We cannot let the good guys win this time, people. We must capture this son of a spy, we must find out the location of the diamond, and we must use it for our own diabolical ends! Mr. Chairman turns to Mr. Smith, businesslike. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) Copy that to all department heads. Mr. Chairman pets the caiman and smiles thinly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) Soon the Acme Corporation shall tower over all of creation!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOARD
dialogues.text: (together) All of creation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman LAUGHS EVILLY. The board joins in. As their laughter builds we PULL OUT, through the glass walls. The ACME skyscraper towers above all others.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. The laughter stops abruptly and we zip back into the boardroom. One of the executives points to the hologram of the car. In it, Daffy has his head stuck out the window like a dog and his bill is flapping in his face.

dialogues.speaker: V.P., RHETORICAL QUESTIONS
dialogues.text: What about the duck?

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) Extra crispy. The EVIL LAUGHS resume and we PULL OUT again, as before.

dialogues.speaker: FILM LEADER
dialogues.text: A clapboard reads: "BACK IN ACTION / SCENE: 7 / TAKE: 1 /

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: “PEER GYNT,” as arranged by Carl Stalling

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Duck season!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE KNIGHT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (Daffy Duck voice) Rabbit season! Reveal Bugs arguing with Wayne Knight in his duck suit. Elmer stands between them with shotgun, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Duck season!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Rabbit season!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Rabbit season. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE KNIGHT
dialogues.text: I say it's duck season and I say fire! Elmer raises his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warner Bros, Bugs, Kate, and Elmer watch the screen as we hear a SHOTGUN BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: (shielding his eyes) Turn it off. Turn it off! The lights come up. Bugs sips a carrot juice.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Probably shoulda filmed that last instead of first.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: We need another duck.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Is Rob Schneider still in the business?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I will not work with Rob Schneider.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: Well then, I’m out of ideas.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER'S BROTHER
dialogues.text: I’ve never had an idea.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Let's see. We need a duck who can take a shotgun blast to the head. Who could it be... Let me think... Hmmmmmmmmmmmmm...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? That I got rid of Daffy? I got rid of Daffy. And I stand by my decision.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: (casual) You're fired. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER'S BROTHER
dialogues.text: (casual) You got rid of our best duck.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You can’t fire me! My movies have made nine hundred and fifty million dollars!

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: That’s not a billion.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (back-pedalling) I think we can all agree that the decision to get rid of Daffy was a poor one. But it’s time to move on and by move on I mean reversing course and getting Daffy back.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WARNER
dialogues.text: By Monday. This movie is costing us a million dollars a day. MR. WARNER’S BROTHER Plus gratuities.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I‘ll have Daffy back by Monday. Bugs pokes his head into frame and waggles his eyebrows. Kate exhales in frustration and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, determined, drives along. An air vent on the passenger side dashboard pops off and Daffy squeezes through it. He sits next to DJ.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I’m getting a little tired of throwing you out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: That’s my plan in a nutshell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: But listen up: my dad’s never asked for my help before, and I’m not going to let anything get in my way. So if you screw this up, even once...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You gotta spot me three screw-ups.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Once. And your liver’s on toast points.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (ignoring that) Now if we run into anything that requires superspy skills, like cracking wise or smooching dames, you'd be better leave that to me. However, if we have any security guarding needs... DJ laughs sarcastically.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Funny, funny duck. But I’m not a security guard, okay? That’s just what I do for money. What I really am, is I’m a stuntman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You? <Raspberry of disbelief>

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You see those Mummy movies? I’m in them more than Brendan Fraser is. (suddenly bitter) And he couldn’t stand that.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You’d better leave everything to me.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Duck, I’d like to remind you that you are a duck. While I am a man. With a man's brain. And opposable thumbs. DJ wiggles his thumb in Daffy's face.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but can you do this? Daffy produces a giant mallet and hits himself on the head. This causes him to break apart into dozens of little Daffys who make high-pitched "woo hoo"s all over the car, almost causing DJ to lose control of the wheel. They then converge and re-form into Daffy, who smiles cockily at DJ. DJ just looks at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I can grow a beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Acme taxi pulls away, depositing Kate. EXT. DRAKE HOUSE - DOOR — MOMENTS LATER 35 Kate approaches the door and knocks. The door opens slightly. She pushes the door open and enters.  36 37 38

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (calls) Mr. Drake? DJ... Kate walks around.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not here to fire you again... I just want to know if that duck told you where he was-— Just then, Kate hears something. It’s coming from:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate opens the door. Steam pours out. She enters. INT. DRAKE HOUSE — BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS 38 A misty shroud. As it clears, Kate sees a silhouette in the shower. Kate pulls back the curtain. Bugs turns in terror, ina shot identical to “Psycho.”

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: <scream> QUICK CUTS duplicate the “Psycho” shower scene precisely, except of course Kate just stands there, befuddlement turning to annoyance. Bugs, on the tile, his eye unblinking. Kate looks down at him, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Cut it out. Kate turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugs sits very close to a TV, displaying hash, a la “Poltergeist,” His head turns slowly toward Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Not in here.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A now very harried Kate marches off and down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the door behind her. She storms over to another door. She opens it and sees: INT. DRAKE HOUSE — BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS 40 Bugs floats above the bed, a la the “Exorcist.”

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (DEMON VOICE)
dialogues.text: He’s not in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate SLAMS the door and storms to:

dialogues.speaker: A HALLWAY 43
dialogues.text: Two child-proportioned Bugs stand side by side, a la “The Shining.”

dialogues.speaker: TWO BUGS
dialogues.text: Not here. Not here. Kate emits a tiny shriek and turns away. She walks into:

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN 44
dialogues.text: Kate is relieved. At least there’s no Bugs here. However, there is that large metal pot boiling over on the stove. The lid of the pot lifts up. Bugs is in the pot.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I will not be ignored. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (losing it) What are you doing?!! Bugs casually hops out of the pot and walks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Shtick. Bugs shakes himself dry, like a dog, wetting Kate. He exits jauntily. A furious Kate stalks after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks out but Bugs has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why are you torturing me? What- Kate stops. She sees the Damian Drake movie posters.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I fired the son of our biggest star. This has been a career- making day, Kate. (getting weepy) First you get rid of that duck everybody hates but then of course they all want him back, but worst of all you get in a big fight with Bugs Bunny, who you revere and who you've tried to model your life after... Right next to Kate, the visor on a suit of armor lifts up. Bugs is inside, also crying.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I hate to see a grown man cry, especially when its a girl. Listen, would it make you stop bawling if I told you Daffy said he was going to Las Vegas with some guy named DJ?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (really bawling) How am I supposed to get to Las Vegas? My car’s waterlogged! Bugs “opens” the chest of the armor and climbs out. He puts his arm around Kate’s waist and leads her to a door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, stop your sobbing now. Let Uncle Bugsy take of it. I know how we can get to Vegas... He flicks a light switch next to a door and opens it.  46 47 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spy car looks fast even standing still. Kate’s tears instantly dry up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (all business) Perfect. Kate exits. Bugs realizes:

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I been played. (further realizing) And I liked it! INT. GARAGE — SPY CAR - A BEAT LATER 47 Kate fastens her seat belt. Bugs fastens his seat belt. Then another belt. Then 23 more belts, topped with a bicycle helmet. He turns to Kate, as if to a chauffeur.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Las Vegas, driver. The inside of the spy car suddenly glows to life.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Taking you to Las Vegas. The engine ROARS. Kate takes her hands off the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car leaps out of the garage. Its wheels don't touch the ground until the end of the driveway. It fishtails into the street, then zooms off like a stock car. EXT. GRANNY’S HOUSE - YARD - CONTINUOUS 48A Granny is watering her lawn with a hose. She turns to watch the car careen off. In doing so, she happens to shoot water in Sylvester's wide open mouth, which had been poised to eat Tweety. Tweety flies out of Sylvester’s paw and he fills with water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A water-filled Sylvester staggers backwards and into a spiky cactus plant. He staggers forward and lands face first on the lawn. The water shoots from the holes in his back, gently sprinkling the lawn as he rolls back and forth in pain. Satisfied that this will work, Granny walks into the house with Tweety on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: Poor puddy tat. He wet himself.  49 50 51 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge casino’s facade is a six-story neon Yosemite Sam. He waves bags of gold. Across Sam’s hat letters sparkle: "THE WOODEN NICKEL. An Acme Casino." The marquee reads, “Now Appearing: Dusty Tails.” The Gremlin pulls into the valet parking area. PUSH IN on "Sam’s" eyes. We see they are windows, into: INT. WOODEN NICKEL — SAM’S OFFICE — CONTINUOUS 50 YOSEMITE SAM is confronted by Mr. Smith.

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: You want the varmints and what they come for. I gotcha. But what’s in it for Sam? Mr. Smith reaches off-frame and produces a treasure chest. He places it on the desk in front of Sam. When Mr. Smith opens the chest, a GOLDEN GLOW bathes Sam’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: <greedy chuckle> Mr. Smith grabs Sam’s head, shoves it in the chest, and calmly SLAMS the lid on it several times. Sam emerges with a couple of teeth missing.

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: I gotcha. INT. WOODEN NICKEL — CASINO - CONTINUOUS 51 DJ and Daffy enter and react in amazement. A wild, Wild West-themed casino. A savage brawl involving several cowboys is in progress. One smashes another over the head with a slot machine. The victim goes down. A beat, and he gets up; indicates the others should join him. The cowboys hold hands and bow. APPLAUSE. BLAM BLAM BLAM! Cartoon bullets strike Daffy's upper bill, spinning it clockwise around his head. Another bullet hits his lower bill, spinning out of sync with the first. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A third hits his upper bill as it rounds the other side, spinning it in the opposite direction. It's now completely askew. People APPLAUD.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Wow. You can almost smell the gunpowder.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (dryly) Yes. An incredible simulation. INT. CASINO — A FEW FEET AWAY — CONTINUOUS 52 NASTY CANASTA and COTTONTAIL SMITH stand, guns smoking. Sam smacks them with his hat.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No, you imbeciles! We wait till he gets what’s he’s coming for!

dialogues.speaker: NASTY CANASTA
dialogues.text: And then we blast him?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Then we blast him.

dialogues.speaker: NASTY CANASTA
dialogues.text: (holstering gun) Long as we get to blast ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ walks close to the stage, looking for a way to sneak backstage. Daffy follows, excitedly reading a Playbill with a picture of Dusty on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Did you know Dusty Tails sang the theme songs to six Damian Drake movies?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Yes. He’s my father. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I keep failing to see the resemblance, somehow. (re: program) Ooh, I hope she sings the love theme from “The Throat Punchers.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The house lights drop.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: A SHAPELY COWGIRL descends from above on a swing, dressed in Victorian clothes. It’s DUSTY TAILS.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: (sweet) When I was just a little girl, my dear old grandmama took me aside, and she said to me: MUSIC STARTS. Dusty sings a country-fried cover of the Backstreet Boys’ “If you Wanna Be a Good Girl (Get Yourself a Bad Man)” DUSTY (CONT’D) (singing)

dialogues.speaker: YOURSELF A BAD MAN...
dialogues.text: Dusty lifts her dress, and little YOSEMITE SAMS run out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 55 36. EXT. HIGHWAY 15 — MOJAVE DESERT — EVENING 54 The spy car streaks along.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS/DAFFY
dialogues.text: (sings) VIVA, LAS VEGAS/ VIVA — INT. SPY CAR — CONTINUOUS 55 Bugs FLAILS on a banjo as he sings. Kate grabs the banjo and throws it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: You've got no music in your soul, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I'm aware of that, yes. Bugs shrugs and turns to the dashboard. It's a dizzying array of hardware. Bugs’ hand hovers over the switches.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Jeesh, he went for all the options. Chump.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t touch anything. This is Damian Drake’s car, and if- Bugs flicks a switch. Through the back windshield we see two white jet streams shoot out. A moment later, two huge fireballs erupt a half mile back.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: <dismissive sound> Bugs scans the array of buttons.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: If you touch one more button -

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Shh. I'm about to defy you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bugs reaches. Kate blocks him. In doing so, she places the palm of her hand on a flat black panel on the dashboard. The panel glows. Kate quickly pulls her hand away, but a perfect fingerprint map of her hand remains. Across the bottom of the panel flashes the words “SEARCHING...”

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you done it. The handprint disappears and it replaced by Kate’s driver's license photo, surrounded by a dizzying array of personal information: height, weight, credit card numbers, cholesterol, etc.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Katharine Beatrice Houghton

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Beatrice? Assorted photos flash on the screen, including a one-year old Kate naked in a bath, a very fat 10-year-old Kate, and finally 16-year-old Kate in a cheerleading outfit.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: IQ, one hundred and six.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (defensive) I was only eight years old! (bitter) You get one peg in the wrong hole and you’re branded for life.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In high school, she was head cheerleader. All the other cheerleaders hated her...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think we’ve heard enough. On the screen is a full-length picture of Kate. Various parts of her body and face light up in red. The title over the illustration reads “PROBLEM AREAS.” Kate’s finger pushes a button next to touch screen. But instead of stopping the narration, A FLURRY OF ROBOTIC ARMS shoot out of the dash and attack Kate and Bugs. She screams. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car swerves all over the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot arms retract, revealing a discombobulated Kate and Bugs wearing scuba gear.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Her freshman year of college, she gained thirty pounds and wore the same sweat pants for five months. Annoyed, Kate pushes the button again. The robotic arms flurry in, leaving Kate in a stunning evening gown and Bugs in a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimated number of cats she will have at age fifty: thirty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives off as we hear...

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: <exasperated yell>

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Man, I love this show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty sings and dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ and Daffy watch this from the wings.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (loud stage whisper) Psst. Dusty! DUSTY! Dusty looks to the wings, annoyed, and continues singing.  59 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chorus of Yosemite Sams line-dance behind Dusty. A hand reaches out from the wings and yanks one of them backstage. Much too soon later, DJ emerges wearing the ill-fitting costume and mask. Aping the dance moves, he makes his way toward Dusty, shoving the other Sams aside. The song hits a dance break. DJ sees his opening and sidles up to Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: (annoyed) You know the rules. You grow, you go. Dusty attempts to dance away from DJ. He hooks her into a dosie-do and speaks to her urgently.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I’m DJ Drake, Damien’s son.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: What? How do I know you’re really...? DJ spins Dusty into a masterful embrace. Her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are Damien’s son.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINGS
dialogues.text: An annoyed Daffy fingers the script.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I don’t have anything to do at all in this scene.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Note: The below bold-faced business may have been cut. Dusty and DJ finish the number. BIG APPLAUSE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Daffy runs in and slides across the stage on his knees, stopping in front of Dusty and DJ. He throws his arms open theatrically. The applause abruptly stops. DJ picks Dusty up and carries her off-stage.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINGS
dialogues.text: DJ deposits Dusty. The LITTLE SAM whose costume DJ is wearing is standing there in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (To little Sam) Hey, thanks a lot. If I can ever, if you need anything taken down off a high shelf or something... ALT. DJ hands Little Sam a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Don’t I pay you enough?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SAM
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) No. +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ sits on a chair while Daffy pokes around, as usual.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Please excuse me while I change... Dusty goes behind a scrim and starts to undress.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Okay, but I don’t have much time. My dad’s in trouble. He told me to ask you about the Blue Monkey. Dusty sticks her head out from the scrim.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: So then you know?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (badly faking) Oh, yeah. Sure. Definitely yes. Dusty goes back behind the scrim again.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: I figured something must have happened when he didn’t show up. I’m so sorry. But that’s what comes with being a spy. DJ is stunned. Daffy perks up.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ha! I was right! And somebody else was wrong! By process of elimination, that must be- Dusty pokes her head out again.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: What’s the duck talking about? DJ twists Daffy’s bill closed like tin foil.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (dazed) Nothing. So, you’re a spy, too?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY, (BEHIND SCRIM)
dialogues.text: The pop diva thing, that’s only one side of me. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY, (BEHIND SCRIM)
dialogues.text: I also work for the agency as a professional assassin. It’s really hard juggling the two sometimes. I don’t know what I’m going to do when I have kids... DJ tries to absorb everything.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: All this time my dad was a spy and I thought he was just a movie star...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Now I see the resemblance. Successful action hero, failed stunt man. Superspy, pseudo-cop... DJ yanks off Daffy’s bill and throws it across the room. Miffed, Daffy walks after it. DJ EXHALES MEANINGFULLY.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: You know how hard it is to find a nanny with advanced weapons training? Dusty walks out from behind the scrim. She is a black leather catsuit, replete with taloned gloves, an infrared scope over one eye, etc. Daffy, who was about to put his bill back on,

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (explaining) The Liechtenstein ambassador is in town. It’s payback time. DJ stands to address Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: So, what about this Blue Monkey?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Your father’s mission was to track it down before forces of evil et cetera, et cetera. I was supposed to give him this. now wearing black drops it. Dusty reaches to her make-up mirror and removes a playing stuck to the side. Daffy grabs it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: This isn’t a king-sized diamond. This is a queen of diamonds! Whose idea of a sick joke is this? Dusty nonchalantly karate chops Daffy’s head, leaving a visible dent. She takes the card back. DJ reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I’ll take that. Dusty puts the card down her front.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: That’s sweet, DJ, wanting to take over for your father. But these evil forces, they’re bad people...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: My father wanted me to do this...

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. We’ve got trained professionals who get paid --. Well, not great money to tell you the truth... Daffy crosses, wearing a long gray coat and putting on a homburg.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Some treasure hunt this turned out to be... Daffy opens the dressing room door. On the other side of the door is Sam and his gang, standing next to a lit cannon. DJ reflexively grabs Dusty and dives out of the way. The cannon BLASTS. The cannon ball hits Daffy in the stomach and he flies into Dusty’s make-up mirror. And through it. And through the wall behind it. INT. CASINO — DRESSING AREA — CONTINUOUS Daffy and the cannonball fly through an area where showgirls are applying make-up and straightening their stockings. A beat later, the cannonball returns for whence it came, and Daffy tips his bill. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ladies. The cannonball shoots back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Daffy-laden cannonball seriously disrupts some dance number.

dialogues.speaker: OFF STAGE
dialogues.text: The Daffy-laden cannonball flies right into a glass case containing a fire extinguisher. The case immediately explodes with white foam. INT. DUSTY’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Sam and the gang enter the dressing room, guns blazing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: DJ lies on top of Dusty. He plucks the card from her front, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you’re getting into.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: That’s what makes life interesting. DJ jumps to his feet and exits in the direction the cannon ball went. Sam and the gang start to follow, but Dusty, still on the floor, kicks all three of them backward. She leaps to her feet and starts kicking the stuffing out of Sam and his gang.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HOLE BLASTED IN WALL
dialogues.text: DJ fights through the dust and debris and onto: INT. CASINO — STAGE — CONTINUOUS DJ makes his way across stage.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: DJ runs in, reaches into the foam and pulls out a foam- covered Daffy. DJ gives Daffy a shake and the foam comes off. Daffy spits a prodigious stream of foam. A cannonball shatters the wall above them. They run off. A beat later, Sam and gang run through. Nasty has the cannon under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ and Daffy climb a ladder to a second floor landing, with Sam and the gang in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ faces off against Sam’s gang. DJ kicks Cottontail over the railing and into a coal trolley full of money below. Nasty finally grabs DJ. The card is DJ’s shirt pocket flies loose. DJ extricates himself Nasty. DJ runs to the railing. Daffy jumps onto his shoulders. DJ sees the card fly away. DJ dives for a chandelier. He misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ (and Daffy) falls through a poker table, the game being played entirely by LOONEY TUNES DOGS in a tableau reminiscent of “Dogs Playing Poker.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE CARD
dialogues.text: Flies through the air, landing in a stack of cards in an electric card shuffler, where they are SHUFFLED. The deck is transferred to card shoe at a blackjack table. (The back of DJ's card is red; the others are blue.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ and Sam zip up almost simultaneously and take seats at the table. The dealer is FOGHORN LEGHORN.

dialogues.speaker: FOGHORN LEGHORN
dialogues.text: Place your bets, gentlemen. DJ and Sam quickly place their bets. Foghorn deals. In the b.g., Daffy runs up and down the fake rock formations as Nasty and Cottontail hurl lit cartoon sticks of dynamite at him. Each one hits its mark. FOGHORN LEGHORN (CONT’D) (to DJ) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: FOGHORN LEGHORN
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to look at your cards first, son? (to camera) Boy's got a lot to learn.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Just hit me. An ace. (DJ already has a two showing)

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hit me again.

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: Hit me! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOGHORN LEGHORN
dialogues.text: Await your turn, sir. Foghorn hits DJ. An ace. In the near b.g., Daffy bucks by holding onto the horns of the BULL from “Bully for Bugs.” Cottontail and Nasty give pursuit on tiny, cartoon horses.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hit me. Hit me. Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: No! Hit me, frazznabbit!

dialogues.speaker: FOGHORN LEGHORN
dialogues.text: I’‘1l hit you when I hit you. Foghorn deals DJ an ace, an ace, a two. Sam is growing with rage.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hit me. Hit me. Hit me. An ace, an ace and... the red-backed Queen of Diamonds. DJ turns over his bottom card. It’s an ace.

dialogues.speaker: FOGHORN LEGHORN
dialogues.text: Twenty-one. A winner. DJ takes off with the Queen before Foghorn can hand him his winnings. A beat later, Daffy runs on top of the table, sweeps up the winnings, and exits. Cottontail and Nasty run across the table a second later. Sam gets up to follow, but takes one last peek at his bottom card and says:

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: Hit me. Foghorn picks Sam up and matter-of-factly whacks him repeatedly on the ass with a wooden plank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run out to a line of parked cars. DJ hops into the driver's seat of the Gremlin. He’s about to start it when Daffy jumps through the window and onto his lap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: All right, let’s see what this spy car can do! Daffy turns the key. The Gremlin falls to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s an interesting feature... Cannonballs and bullets fly over their heads. DJ grabs Daffy and runs.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE VALET
dialogues.text: Race driver JEFF GORDON, in a NASCAR racing suit, steps up and hands the valet a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: It’s a modified Chevrolet with DuPont and Pepsi logos all over and a big “24” on the side. The valet runs off and zips up in Gordon’s race car in the same moment. The valet opens the door to let Gordon in, but Sam and his gang shove past him and into the car. The race car zooms off. Gordon looks confused, then notices the valet has his hand out for a tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ and Daffy run through the crowded bazaar. Daffy suddenly stops at a vendor selling black market T-shirts. He holds up a T-shirt of himself wearing hip-hop clothes.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: How much for this one? Several cartoon bullets fly into frame, and pierce the T- shirt Daffy in several strategic locations. Daffy zips o.s., followed very closely by the NASCAR vehicle, driven by Sam.  70 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, frustrated, drives through Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: There’s got to be 314 hotels and 142 casinos in Las Vegas. We're never going to find that duck! Bugs casually points ahead. Daffy runs into the street, waving his arms and SCREAMING. The car hits Daffy and he’s plastered against the windshield, bug-like.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (admiration) Daff never misses a cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spy car SCREECHES to a halt. A second later, DJ runs up, peels Daffy off the windshield and tosses him in the window of the Spy car. He opens the door:

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Excuse me- He sees Kate.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir. DJ unhooks Kate’s seatbelt quickly, tosses her into the far seat and jumps in. DJ hits the gas and the spy car peels out milliseconds before the NASCAR flies out onto the street, fishtails and gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD 71A
dialogues.text: The spy car takes a sharp left turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy badgers Bugs in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: If you think you’re gonna horn in on my action here, you’re tragically mistaken! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: When have I ever horned in? Bugs subtly moves toward center screen and back, forcing Daffy’s head to look at him, in other words, upstaging him. Daffy falls out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (slightly off mic) Stop upstaging me, you, Nomi Malone! (off of Bugs’ look, casual) The character Elizabeth Berkeley played in “Showgirls.” (back to scene) This is my spot. Daffy pushes his face in front of Bugs’, into the focus. However, the light is no longer generous. His bill looks blemished and his feathers appear to be thinning on top. He smiles for a beat, then realizes he doesn’t look good and backs into the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASCAR car pulls up beside the spy car. They’re neck- and-neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate seethes at DJ. He acts nonchalant, even as he is steering the car wildly to and fro.

dialogues.speaker: DI
dialogues.text: So what brings you to Las Vegas? Run out of people to fire in the state of California? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  73

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: First you steal my duck, then you-- Kate stops, mouth agape. She sees Sam reaching across from his car with a lit bundle of dynamite. Sam politely knocks on DJ’s window.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hysterical) Dynamite? Who has dynamite? DJ sees they are approaching a wall of stopped traffic. He puts the car into a spectacular fishtail.

dialogues.speaker: ON NASCAR CAR
dialogues.text: Sam, noticing this, pulls the dynamite back in. It starts to move toward the spy car when, of course, the dynamite explodes.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SPY CAR
dialogues.text: Kate is eerily calm.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I'd like to get out now.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Relax, I’m a licensed stunt driver.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re a security guard!!!

dialogues.speaker: DI
dialogues.text: (suddenly bitter) Talk to Brendan Fraser about that. DJ slams the wheel into reverse, and then the car does all that cool shit you have planned.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 73A
dialogues.text: EXT. LAS VEGAS STREET —- CONTINUOUS DJ is pretty pleased with his trick driving. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: He makes it look so easy. Kate matter-of-factly points out the windshield. We see that the NASCAR is actually waiting on the corner for them. DJ throws the car into an extreme hard left down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: They’re apparently going very fast. DJ looks in his rearview.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: Daffy’s face is blocking the view.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Go up on two wheels! Go up on two wheels!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: DJ turns back and pushes Daffy’s head aside to get a better view of how close the NASCAR is. As he does, Bugs appears, pointing forward.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I’m curious. Are we gonna stop before we hit that wall? I got to make arrangements either way. Yes, the car is directly headed for a wall; in fact, it’s the back wall of Sam’s casino.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (cowering) Mother. The dashboard flickers to life.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Taking you to Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JET ROAR. Flames shoot out the back of the spy car, torching the front of the NASCAR car behind it. The spy car lifts off and flies up over the casino wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
