dialogues.text: Sam, a bit charred, watches through the windshield as the spy car gives flight, revealing the wall they are about to hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASCAR crashes through the wall. People scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam clings to the wheel; eyes wide. Several showgirls scatter before him. The race car flies off the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASCAR car crashes nose first and Sam is hurled through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is hurled down the mine shaft and into:

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS 97B
dialogues.text: A match is lit, illuminating Sam’s face. He notices he is surrounded by dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge fireball belches from the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 98-100
dialogues.text: EXT. THE NIGHT SKY — CONTINUOUS 101 The Spy Car rockets along nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugs glances out her window, and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glittering Las Vegas. Suddenly, a huge fireball blasts through the roof of the Wooden Nickel, shattering Yosemite Sam’s neon visage. As the fireball gets closer, we see it is a screaming Sam, his ass ablaze. The flaming Sam shoots by the window of the Spy Car.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Everybody, make a wish!

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I’m beginning to suspect that this one is the spy car. Kate turns to DJ, dripping with sarcasm

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, you killed me. Happy?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (concerned) Okay, okay, I can handle this. Don’t worry. I... I’ve played some video games... DJ flicks the turn signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rockets re-orient. The car noses into a power dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone SCREAMS. DJ tries quickly turns the turn signal back. The turn signals go on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HIS FOOT
dialogues.text: works the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR 109
dialogues.text: plummets toward the rocky desert.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS 110
dialogues.text: SCREAMS weakly, voice cracking. A couple of quick squirts of throat spray and he’s SCREAMING LIKE A GIRL again.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPY CAR 112
dialogues.text: streaks toward the ground. KA-CHUNK! The engine rumbles.

dialogues.speaker: DASHBOARD
dialogues.text: The fuel gauge reads “E”

dialogues.speaker: THE SPY CAR
dialogues.text: Sputters and jerks as the engines go out. The car comes to a stop in mid-air, three feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: I’m totally out of gas. After a beat, the door opens and Bugs climbs out to the ground. He shakes his leg.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Hey, look at that. My leg fell asleep. Bugs continues shaking his leg as the other clearly more affected passengers stumble out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot sun. PAN DOWN to a tall cactus, with a couple of vultures, staring down at: Kate, Bugs and Daffy, sitting on the ground, looking very much goners. A thick stream of liquid hits Bugs’s head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUG
dialogues.text: (to vultures) Quit drooling! I‘’11l tell you when I’m dead! Kate is fiddling with her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No service? What are we, on Mars? (drops phone, weepy) This wasn’t the plan. I’m supposed to start my own production company in two years, go to Cannes, where I meet a wealthy French businessman, get married and then after five years have a baby, a boy, followed by a girl three years later. I’m not supposed to be dying in the desert with a rabbit and a duck and a handsome yet goofy unemployed person!

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (wistful) I was going to be a dancer. DJ strolls up to the group, no worse for wear.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Nothing ten miles in that, that or that direction. So I suggest we go that way. Bugs falls to his knees, grabbing at DJ's legs.

dialogues.speaker: BUG
dialogues.text: Who you kidding, ol’ sod? We’re goners. Water! We’re gonna die out here, alone, our dramatic death throes unseen by the voting members of the Motion Picture Academy! (weakly) Agua por favor... DJ is distracted by something on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hey, look!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DESERT
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A heat wave apparition? No, it’s... it’s a Walmart, with no parking lot or roads leading to it. Bugs gets up and dusts himself off, no worse for wear.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (aside, to audience) Man, how much did that cost ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Who cares, with shopping convenience at such low prices! Daffy runs toward the Walmart. DAFFY (CONT’D) Water! Fresca! Mountain Dew! Gatorade products! EXT. DESERT WALMART — LATER Our heroes happily exit, outfitted with new outfits, waterbottles, drinks and brand name snacks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 114
dialogues.text: INT. ACME BUILDING — BOARDROOM — DAY 115 This image appears on the floating video screen on the dais. Mr. Chairman pushes a button in the remote. Nothing happens. He hits the remote with the butt of his hand, pushes a button and the video screen goes up. Mr. Chairman picks up another remote. He points it upwards and pushes a button. An upside-down trussed-up Yosemite Sam is lowered to several inches below Mr. Chairman’s eye level. He pushes another button. Sam is lifted to several inches above eye level. He pushes a third adjustment gets it right.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE SAM
dialogues.text: Mistakes were made. By others.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you for your report. Mr. Chairman pushes a button on his remote. Sam zips up out of frame. A beat later, we see Sam falling past the window. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) It now appears that in order to obtain the location of the Blue Monkey, we will have to exterminate two people and a rabbit and a duck. Any moral objections?

dialogues.speaker: THE BOARD
dialogues.text: (EVIL CHUCKLES)/ Good one. Mr. Chairman walks over to where Damian Drake is hanging in a gibbet cage. (Next to him stands THE MAD SCIENTIST lovingly examining various instruments of torture on a table before him.) Mr. Chairman picks up a hand mixer from the table and menaces Damian.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Unless, Mr. Drake, you would like to save us the bother of eliminating your son? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: My son is going to kick your evil butt! He varsity-lettered in wrestling and he was a National Merit Scholar Semi-finalist! Mr. Chairman CHUCKLES but actually seems a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: V.P., BAD IDEAS
dialogues.text: Uh, Mr. Chairman, a suggestion? Perhaps we should activate our desert operative. Mr. Chairman and the other board members roll their eyes. V.P., BAD IDEAS (CONT’D) He's due for a win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILE E. COYOTE is chasing the Road Runner, about to catch him, when: SFX: Phone ring Coyote stops abruptly and picks up a phone that's built into an organ-pipe cactus. He holds up a small sign:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, Daffy, Kate and Bugs walk together, in a tableau reminiscent of the “Wild Bunch,” or “Stand by Me,” or something.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You know, Kate, for an executive in charge of a comedy starring a bunny and a duck, you seem a little... what’s the word?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Humorless.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Stick-in-the-muddy, Crabby Patty- ish, Sour persimmons-ized...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Unfun, despotic, Satan-like... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m trying to do my job. Which, by the way, does not involve so- called spies and monkeys and diamonds...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (insulted) I’m doing this for my father.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: He desperately hopes he can finally win his poppa’s love and respect after years of slacking and poor career choices.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You watch too many movies.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: The lady doth protest too much, me thinks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: That’s nothing. This one wants to become the most powerful woman in Hollywood just to show those numbskulls back at Cooper High that they shoulda made her Homecoming Queen.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (reliving tragedy) I gave the best speech! They only gave it to Susie Farkas because she had one leg shorter than the other!

dialogues.speaker: BINOCULAR MATTE
dialogues.text: Long angle of Kate, DJ, Daffy and Bugs.

dialogues.speaker: WILE E. COYOTE 118
dialogues.text: lowers his binoculars and silently sniggers. He's sitting on an office chair; he turns to face a desktop computer on a rock with a power cord trailing 0O.S..

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Displays a very professional ACME.COM WEBSITE. The tagline reads, “For all your mayhem needs.” EXT. DESERT — CONTINUOUS 118A Bugs and Daffy continue their catalogue of embarrassments as DJ and Kate look on helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: You know, he’s no prize either. Cocky for no reason at all, acts without thinking...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: She thinks her rear’s too big. DJ glances back at Kate’s butt. She smacks him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: He likes long walks on the beach...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You just made that up!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: She has a weakness for unemployed guys.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: He has a weakness for being unemployed...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Could it be...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS/DAFFY
dialogues.text: (heads together) ...love? DJ and Kate surreptitiously check out the other’s reaction to that. When they see they’re being checked out, they both scowl. PAN UP to see that atop a rock formation just ahead is:

dialogues.speaker: WILE E. COYOTE 120
dialogues.text: Typing fiendishly at his computer.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Displays a gaily colored page for an "ACME Armored Rocket Launcher and Sports Utility Vehicle." The mouse pointer clicks the "BUY" button. The screen reads "Would you like gift wrap?" and a graphic bug blinks: "FREE!" The pointer clicks on "YES." The screen responds,"Your order is on its way!" WILE E. rubs his hands together gleefully. Then a wooden crate the size of a bungalow tressed with a ribbon LANDS on him, flattening the entire area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 EXT. DESERT — CONTINUOUS 121 Kate is getting hot and cranky.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Somebody is going to pay for this.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Her assistant, most likely.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Look, when we get back to civilization, you can take your duck and rabbit and make your little movie. I neither solicit nor desire your help in saving my father...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You don’t really believe Damien Drake was kidnapped, do you?

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Sure, I’ll believe anything! That’s how I have so many wacky adventures.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I saw it happen.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He was probably just on location, shooting a scene. Or, I don’t know, but he’s somewhere. I mean, people don’t just— DJ vanishes in thin air. Just as Daffy notices this, he smacks into thin air.  122-124 125 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ has walked through a “doorway” surrounded by some kind of invisible field. He can see the others on the other side, as if looking through Polarized sunglasses. He watches as Daffy shakes himself off and smacks right into the force field again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Bugs are feeling this invisible wall as Daffy staggers around. DJ head pops out of thin air.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hey, everybody, it’s air- conditioned in here! DJ yanks Bugs and Kate into thin air. A moment later, Kate reaches out and yanks Daffy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four look around, amazed. On one side, the desert; on the other some kind of gleaming, high-tech laboratory. Suddenly, a giant angry MONSTER is headed straight for them, claws waving, teeth bared and ROARING.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: <monster-provoked screams>

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes are petrified. The drooling beast closes the gap with a few powerful strides. It positions its maw to snap Kate in two. A metal claw drops from 0.S. and picks up the creature bodily just before it can pounce. Kate goes weak in the knees; Bugs steadies her. Daffy goes weak in the knees; DJ lets him drop to the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The claw lowers the monster carefully into what looks like a giant Mason jar. Another device screws on a giant metal top; a third machine punches air holes. As our foursome watches, a phalanx of jump-suited minions carrying metal poles forms before them.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Ah, here you are. Now if you’ll lead me to your queen— Daffy strides forward. One of the guards touches Daffy with his pole. He melts into a puddle on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LIQUID DAFFY
dialogues.text: That's relaxing. A woman in a smock with an elaborate ID badge emerges from the phalanx. This is MOTHER. She is accompanied by Robby THE ROBOT.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hello, DJ. I’m Mother. You can * call me Mom. * Mother turns and beckons them to follow. Robby sucks the puddle of Daffy up with a turkey baster. They start walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother leads them past giant, high-tech fishbowls, Mason jars, etc., holding various space aliens.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: So this is Area Fifty-One, the secret military base where they keep all the space aliens and UFOs and the President’s brain...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: No. Area 51 is a paranoid fantasy * we concocted to hide the real * identity of this facility.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Which is? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Area 52. But don’t quote me on that. The four are led past a large black granite plaque which reads, “Area 52” with the legend, “Keeping things from * the American People Since 1947.” * Daffy’s eyeballs float around in the turkey baster Robby is holding. Kate seems worried about it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You are going to bring him back, aren’t you? I can’t go back to LA with a bowl of duck soup.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: We do have the technology to * reconstitute the body. But his * mind will remain a gooey mess. *

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: That’s the Daffy we all love! * Kate shoots Bugs a sour look. He mimics her expression, walking beside her like Nixon. INT. AREA 52 - LABORATORY — DAY 127 * Mother leads them in. The door shuts with a HISS.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Let me escort you to our debriefing room.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND A GLASS WALL
dialogues.text: A technician works over a sink rinsing off a human brain. Several other brains sit on a drying rack next to the sink. The worker stops to “scrub out” a particularly persistent memory out of the brain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: (Note: In the b.g, a technician starts to reconstitute the liquid Daffy)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Later. Tell me about the Blue Monkey.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: How do you know about that thing you mentioned that I’ve never heard of? In my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: My dad told me.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What’s the point of making them swear a blood oath... (giving in) Okay, I’1l tell you - but you've got to promise me...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (Scout’s oath) Promise. Mother opens a compartment in Robby which contains several videotapes: “Moon Landing Dress Rehearsal,” “Congressmen Gone Wild - Vol. 6,” and “How Sausage is Made.” She pulls out one labelled, “The Blue Monkey.” Mother pops the video into a panel in Robby’s chest. The room goes completely dark and light projects from Robby’s head onto a large “screen” in front of the them. (It fills the movie screen, creating silhouettes out of Mother, DJ, Kate and Bugs.)

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: A scratchy BLUE-BLACK PRINT. The logo is the Great Seal from the one dollar bill. Underneath it reads, “Do Not Read This.” We hear a voice that appears to be coming from the back of whatever theater this movie is playing in.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, down in front! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ/KATE/BUGS/MOTHER
dialogues.text: Sorry, etc. Their silhouettes “sit down.” The title of the film appears: “The Blue Monkey: Why We Must Have It.” Below that it reads, “Produced By Leon Schlesinger” A UPA-STYLE CARTOON DIAMOND appears on screen. A cartoon monkey’s face appears in the diamond.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE MONKEY
dialogues.text: Hi, there! I’m the Blue Monkey! The Blue Monkey jumps out of the diamond and assumes a complete body. He gestures to the diamond. BLUE MONKEY (CONT’D) And this is my diamond. We’re thousands of years old. But don’t let my smile and that sparkle fool you. We could end civilization! The Blue Monkey strolls past some cartoon scientists examining stone tablets and painted vases. BLUE MONKEY (CONT’D) Our boys have been studying ancient writings and feeding all the data into the Electrocipher here... The Electrocipher is an immense 1950s style computer. The lights flash on and off and the computer spits out a punch card. The Blue Monkey takes it. BLUE MONKEY (CONT’D) Hoo boy! According to this, anyone who possesses me will have the power to rise... (spooky echo effect) “Bbove all others”! The Blue Monkey laughs disarmingly. BLUE MONKEY (CONT’D) Yikes. If the Commies get a hold of me first, it’s sayonara freedom! So keep looking for me, good guys! I’m rooting for you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The film ends abruptly with a black screen with plain white lettering: “You saw nothing.” The lights come up. (Note: In the b.g., the reconstitution of Daffy continues. At no point should it unduly distract from the dialogue in the foreground. )

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: It needs updating, but you get the idea. *

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: So that’s why those guys came after my... (epiphany) My dad was going to save the world.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Again. DJ is lost in the repercussions of it all. PULL BACK to reveal Bugs, next to DJ in a parody of his thinking pose.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: So if I go after the diamond, the * bad guys’1l come after me... *

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: We defeat them with our superior pluck... *

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Thus saving my dad and the * world...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: We get William Morris to package * the whole thing...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The sad thing is, it sounds like you've thought this through.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: It’s just crazy enough to work...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Maybe it should be crazier. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: No, it’s definitely crazy enough...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re not seriously thinking of-

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (scornful) You want to take over your father’s mission? (then) I guess that would be okay.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (to Mother) You’re wearing a lab coat. You’re supposed to be smart.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (very casual) How many people would notice if you vanished? (then, to DJ) I have to warn you, DJ, you'll be going up against a evil cabal bent on world domination...

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Do you have any, eh, high-tech spy gidgees?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: <you-gotta-be-kidding sound> Mother pushes a button and a wall behind opens, revealing a dazzling array of gadgetry: laser cannons, floating orbs, high-tech propeller beanies, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Let’s kick some evil butt. DJ steps forward. Mother stops him before he can walk into the special effect.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: None of that stuff works. The door closes. Mother directs DJ to a small table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH HF HHH FH HH HH

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cost a fortune, too. Okay, now I’m going to talk pretty fast because this part’s boring... Mother picks up a cellphone. (Off to the left side of the screen, Bugs takes this opportunity to catch up on his personal grooming: brushes teeth, flosses, combs face...) MOTHER (CONT’D) Looks like an ordinary cellphone... Kate pulls out her cellphone. The two phones are virtually identical. Mother puts the cellphone in DJ’s hand, pushes buttons as she ticks off features. (As she talks, Daffy walks up, hitting alternate side of his head and knocking gooey matter out of his ears.)

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three-way calling, voice dialing, downloadable ring tones... She pushes a button. We hear the first seven notes of “When You Wish Upon a Star.” (Alts: “My Favorite Martian” theme, “Jetsons” theme, “James Bond” theme, and “Secret Agent Man”.)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: My phone does all that.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Superconducting electromagnet... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ's arm is jerked down to the metal table. Mother casually clicks off that button and moves onto the next.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: GPS with mapping software, tip calculator, Gameboy...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (leaning in) Gameboy!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: ..-high-powered laser... A laser beam SHOOTS out and neatly lops off Daffy's head; it drops sideways onto the table. No one much notices. MOTHER (CONT’D) .-.--MP3 player, polycarbonate rappeling line, with jet-propelled micro-grappling hook, nose-hair trimmer and... A holographic HULA DANCER is projected out of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys in the lab spent way too much time on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin sits patiently as a diminutive scientist tentatively extends a robot arm holding a small squeaky toy. The arm SQUEAKS it enticingly. Marvin's helmet "rings." He touches the side of it to answer.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Hello? A mission? Yes, I’m available... Obtain a playing card... and then I can eliminate them all? Oh, goody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugs picks up a pair of pants off the table.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Nice slacks! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Standard pleated front, but with liquid hydrogen pocket rockets here and here... She points to the back pockets, then moves on. She picks up a handheld device shaped-like a nose. (Daffy tapes his head back on with duct tape.) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MOTHER (CONT’D) The Proboscinator. It can generate up to six million smells. She activates it. Smell lines radiate from it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE/DJ/BUGS/DAFFY, (TOGETHER)
dialogues.text: (smelling) Amsterdam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin addresses the scientist with the squeaky toy.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I am no longer amused by this creature’s flatulence. Marvin produces the ray gun and ZAPS the squeaky toy. The scientist runs off. Marvin ZAPS a hole in his glass enclosure. He walks down the hall, ZAPPING open other enclosures. MARVIN (CONT’D) Playtime, friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ secures his equipment (including the slacks).

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Okay, just one more question: where’s the Blue Monkey?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You have the playing card? DJ pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (rote) Well, that’s the window into what lies behind her smile.

dialogues.speaker: DJ/KATE/BUGS/DAFFY
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: As a super spy, you’re supposed to be able to figure the rest out. Sorry. Suddenly, the double doors HISS open. Gobs of aliens and monsters struggle to cram through the door!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, darn. I knew this day would come. She reaches down for

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE RED BUTTON
dialogues.text: Labelled, “PUSH ONLY IN CASE THIS DAY COMES.” Mother slaps the button.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Emergency Shutdown activated. Force barrier seal in ten minutes. INT. AREA 52 - EXIT — CONTINUOUS 132 Personnel run out the automatic double doors that lead to the desert. The doors start to close ominously.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (turning to Mother) What do we do? Mother is being lowered on a small platform that disappears into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: If you have one of these I’d take it. DJ turns back just as a laser beam blasts over his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: holds his laser gun on them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: The playing card, please. Daffy grabs the card from DJ.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I'll take that. (off DJ’s look) I’ve got a greedy nature. I’m as much a victim of it as you are. Daffy runs off and down a hall. Marvin gives chase. Bugs, DJ and Kate face the monsters.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Life was so much simpler in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 132A
dialogues.text: INT. AREA 52 - HALLWAY — CONTINUOUS 133 Daffy runs down a hallway like a maniac. He stops suddenly at a water cooler, and very calmly pours himself some water. He sips it, leaning against the cooler. A laser beam zaps him in the ass. He SCREAMS and runs o.s. Marvin gives pursuit. INT. AREA 52 - LABORATORY — CONTINUOUS 134 DJ wrestles the neck of a TRIFFID. Kate fends off the SPACE GORILLA with girlish kicks and scratches.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You need any help over there?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) No, I can take care of my- As she turns to say this, the Space Gorilla grabs her in a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: Bugs is being approached on two sides by Daleks. He looks scared. Then suddenly, he whips on a boxing referee's outfit. Bugs “confers” with the Daleks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I want a fair fight. A clean fight. No flaming below the belt. Bugs produces a ringside bell and RINGS it. The two Daleks start torching each other.  135 63. INT. AREA 52 - HANGAR 18 — CONTINUOUS 135 Daffy runs into a huge hangar. A large sign says "HANGAR 18." It's filled with all sorts of alien aircraft, including a giant silver cigar with copper band and a humongous pie plate.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: So many models to choose from. A laser beam blows his head clean off. The headless Daffy runs up and hops into a tiny pod saucer. A clear dome covers him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE POD RACER
dialogues.text: His head pops up and surveys at the alien-scripted controls. DAFFY (CONT’D) Foreign jobs.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Marvin rushes in. He sees Daffy. He raises his raygun.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE POD RACER
dialogues.text: Daffy looks grim and in charge.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eenie, meanie, miney, make... it... so... Daffy pushes a button. The Space Pod rockets backwards.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARVIN
dialogues.text: About to squeeze off a shot. His eyes widen as Daffy’s Space Pod hits him at the neck, knocking his head off. Marvin’s head spins several time in the air and then lands back on his shoulders, upside down. Marvin rights his head and turns around in time to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy very poorly executes a three-point turn in the hallway, then rockets o.s.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARVIN
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hands on hips.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m afraid I’m going to have to bust an ion cap in his cloaca! INT. AREA 52 - LABORATORY — CONTINUOUS 136 Kate struggles in arms of the Space Gorilla. It starts petting her head, making cooing noises. DJ walks up, covered in Triffid goo.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (jocular) I think he likes you. The Space Gorilla quickly grabs DJ and pulls him into the same embrace with Kate.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: faces off against the giant-brained MUTANT from “This Island Earth.” The mutant takes a swipe at Bugs. Bugs dodges the claw and quickly climbs up onto the mutant’s brain, riding it like a jockey. Bugs surveys the brain, wiggling his fingers over it.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Open cerebellum! Bugs sticks his fingers into the creases of the brain and starts “operating” the mutant. Under his control, the Mutant does some “robot” dance moves and goes into a moon walk. INT. AREA 52 — HALLWAY Daffy’s space craft flies slowly down a featureless hallway. INT. SPACE POD — CONTINUOUS 137 Daffy looks to and fro, earnestly.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: There’s got to be a restroom here somewhere... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The pod is rocked by an explosion. Daffy gets squashed into the top of the dome.

dialogues.speaker: SQUASHED DAFFY
dialogues.text: (to audience) Always wear seatbelts, kids. Looming up fast behind Daffy’s pod is Marvin in his tiny saucer, blasting away. Daffy “pops” down from the dome, and rockets ahead, straight into camera, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 140-141
dialogues.text: INT. AREA 52 - LABORATORY — CONTINUOUS 142 DJ and Kate are pressed nose to nose, being hugged by the Space Gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Have you been eating space bananas?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Those are the best last words you can think of? The Space Gorilla squeezes them tighter and rocks them like dolls.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE GORILLA
dialogues.text: <electronic cooing sound>

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Hey, I love you, too. I really do. But more as a friend. Or a pet. And I wouldn’t want to endanger that relationship by--

dialogues.speaker: SPACE GORILLA
dialogues.text: <electronic roar>

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, great. You hurt its feelings. The Space Gorilla lifts them both off the ground, squeezing them very, very hard. He’s crushing them.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Get along, li'l space doggy... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Mutant swaggers in, John Wayne-like, with Bugs riding and operating his brain. Under Bugs direction, the Mutant swipes at the Space Gorilla with his claw, knocking the Space Gorilla’s head clean off, exposing the traditional sparking and smoking wires. The Space Gorilla’s body drops DJ and Kate. Bugs makes the Mutant pump his claw in a victory gesture. He raises his claw to DJ.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slap me two! DJ high-fives the claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy’s pod rockets down a seemingly endless maze of hallways, in the best tradition of video-game-derived cinema. Marvin’s pod follows at a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy’s pod zips to a halt in front of the elevator. A robot arm extends and pushes the button. The elevator door opens. Daffy’s pod scoots inside. The door closes. Marvin’s pod pulls up. A robot arm extends and pushes the button several times, impatiently. After a couple seconds, Marvin rotates the pod so it is facing down. He blasts down through the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 143-145
dialogues.text: INT. AREA 52 - LABORATORY — CONTINUOUS Bugs, DJ and Kate compose themselves as they walk to the double doors.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Force barrier seal in five minutes. I’m not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Five whole minutes left? What kind of dramatic tension is that? Suddenly, Marvin’s pod crashes through the ceiling, causing them to duck as he zooms past them. The pod stops a few feet in front and the pod dome retracts.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARVIN
dialogues.text: He pulls out a ketchup-like bottle that reads “INSTANT MARTIANS - NEW SQUEEZE TOP”. He quickly squirts six times and six INSTANT MARTIANS appear in a row in front of our heroes. Marvin zooms off.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s more like it. Our heroes turn to retreat, only to discover that the Mutant, Daleks and Space Gorilla (putting his head back on) are right behind them. Thinking fast, Bugs zips over to Robby the Robot and hits him with the back of his fist. Robby lights up and begins playing the Bruce Johnston’s 1962 surf hit, “Moon Shot.” The aliens look momentarily confused, then start to dance. Kate is about to be hugged by the Space Gorilla again, when DJ grabs her hand and pulls her into a dance. She is momentarily shocked, but then smiles. DJ spins and swings Kate around; with each big movement, the duo kick and punch the aliens. Meanwhile, Bugs sits atop the Mutant, who he is making do the Watusi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin’s spacecraft zooms down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Daffy sits in his floating pod, blissing out to a Muzak version of “The Twilight Zone” theme.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTTONS
dialogues.text: Light up “L,” "LL" and finally “HLL.” Ding! The doors open and Daffy absent-mindedly flies out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens into the upper reaches of huge cartoon cavern, which is quite clearly the FIERY BOWELS OF HELL.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Oopsie. SATAN calls out from the cavern floor.

dialogues.speaker: SATAN
dialogues.text: Close that door! I’m not paying to heat the whole neighborhood! Daffy’s pod zips back into the elevator and the doors close.  66-69. INT. AREA 52 - LABORATORY — CONTINUOUS 159 Aliens and monsters are laid waste everywhere. DJ, Kate and Bugs survey the scene.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (cocky laugh) Super-advanced species, my butt.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Force barrier seal in one minute. I mean it. I’m going to do it. Bugs, DJ and Kate trot for the exit, which is nearly closed. But at the last second, something red steps in the way. They bounce off of it and onto their asses.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSAMER
dialogues.text: Looks down at them, BELLOWING. DJ and Bugs look panicked, but Kate is thinking. She’s got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: “Water, Water, Every Hare”!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (surprised) You saw “Water, Water, Every Hare”?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: 1952, Chuck Jones. (off Bugs’ look) I may be an executive, but I’ma good executive.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: What’s “Water, Water, Every Hare”? If I may ask, I mean, before we get eaten. Kate puts up a finger, indicating “just watch.” She and Bugs hop to their feet and assume the roles of beauticians. They surround a confused Gossamer.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (Queens accent) Oh, Honey, do you go out in that face? Bugs pulls up a chair from nowhere and Kate pushes Gossamer into it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eH FH FHF FH HF

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bugs, in his hairdresser persona from “Water, Water...” rapidly unlaces and removes Gossamer’s sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: You have such lovely monster feet, why smother them in these hideous beasts? Kate already has a large tray at her disposal. She is troweling wax onto Gossamer’s face as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hiding that gorgeous visage under all that hair, you should be horsewhipped! Kate rips the wax off, pulling all the hair off that section of Gossamer’s face. He looks to be in extreme distress.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beauty is pain, girlfriend. Gossamer bites his lip bravely. DJ appears behind Gossamer, wearing a doo-rag for some reason and channelling Paul Lynde. He lifts Gossamer’s hair in mock distress.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Oh my whiskers, we're taking away your henna. Now let’s see what we can do with this bushy bush bush. As he says this, DJ whips out his cell phone. The laser goes on. He cuts a huge swath of hair. As DJ cuts and Kate rips out, Pedicurist Bugs surveys Gossamer’s hairy, taloned feet.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: These toenails are lethal! Bugs whips on goggles and produces a chain saw out of nowhere. He goes to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin’s space craft patrols the hallway. Marvin hears a DOORKNOB turn and the space craft spins 180 degrees. JANITOR’S CLOSET (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eK eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eK

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Reads the door. It opens. Daffy’s pod floats out, in “disguise.” Humongous overalls are worn around the pod’s perimeter and hang limply to the floor. A string mop hangs off the top of the glass bubble in a semblance of a wig.

dialogues.speaker: TARGETING DISPLAY
dialogues.text: Inside the pod, Daffy plays it cool, whistling. Marvin checks the weapons at his disposal. His fingers trace past buttons reading “Laser cannon,” "Angry Letter," "Water Balloons," and finally, "Earth-shattering Kaboom."

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Ideal! Marvin pushes that button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin’s space craft shatters with a HUGE KABOOM (a sonic effect, no fire). The reverberation sends Daffy’s pod flying down the hall, flipping end over end. Marvin sits dazed on the floor, his helmet vibrating.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Kaboom.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 161
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eee HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eee HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, Kate and Bugs surround Gossamer. Kate bends down.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: ...-And just a couple tablespoons of lip gloss and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gossamer, surrounded by mounds of hair, is only about two feet tall. He’s completely shaved, except for a tiny pony tail sprouting from the top of his head. He’s heavily made up, and has glitter toenails. Bugs holds a mirror up to Gossamer’s face. Gossamer shrieks and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (regular voice) I thought he looked nice. The three turn toward the exit just in time to see the doors shut closed.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: I told you I would close it. And I have. So now you’re going to die. Don’t blame me. They’re dumbfounded. Kate turns to Bugs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You had to do French tips. Before this catfight can break out, we hear the rapidly approaching SCREAM of Daffy. The three turn to see Daffy’s pod smashing off of everything and then come careening right at them. They duck just in time. Daffy’s pod CRASHES through sealed doors. DJ, Kate and Bugs rush out.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh, so that’s how it is. When you don’t get your way, you hit. Men. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a * + HHH OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, Kate and Bugs run out of thin air. They see Daffy's space ship bounce around and finally CRASH in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: emerges from the smoke, utterly cool, like Sam Shepard in "The Right Stuff."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Daffy walks into frame, very casual. He turns to the others, revealing for the first time that his entire back half is burnt ash.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (very cool) Did you see how I saved you all from certain deceasement?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I saw how you crashed that rocket ship. Bugs taps Daffy on the head. His ash falls off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate addresses DJ, jocularly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So, what’s next? Jungle adventure? Dinosaurs?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Playing card. DJ pulls out the playing card, sighs.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The window into what lies behind her smile...

dialogues.speaker: THE CARD
dialogues.text: It’s a Queen of Diamonds. Only the Queen looks like:

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mona Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Which is in the Louvre! Which means we have to go to Paris!

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (snippy) I had figured that out, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Then you should have said it. (re card: giddy) We’re going to Paris! DJ, Bugs and Daffy all stare at her, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quickly) You don’t really want me to make a long speech about how discovering that the world is in danger has made me realize how shallow my old values are and how fighting aliens has made me feel truly alive for the first time in my life, do you?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS/ DAFFY/ DJ
dialogues.text: No/ No, thank you, sister/ You're right, we don’t. DJ looks up and around. Desert everywhere. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Okay. So how do we get to Paris?

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Like so. 71A. 163 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bugs "grabs" the far right side of the screen. As he pulls it left, we

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 163A
dialogues.text: EXT. PARIS — DAY 164

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the Champs Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower, and other cliched establishing shots actually taken from other movies. The less the film stock matches, the better. MUSIC: Edith Piaf singing "La Vie en Rose." EXT. THE LOUVRE - DAY — ESTABLISHING 165 A sign reads, "Le Pavillon de Art Fameuse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GALLERY is lined with an eclectic collection not usually found in the Louvre: Hopper's "Night Hawks," Van Gogh's "Starry Night" and the cover of the first Boston album. OUR HEROES stand before the “MONA LISA”. DJ looks at the playing card, then at the painting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Not much of a window...

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF THE CARD
dialogues.text: There’s an odd sheen on it, reflecting the painting. DJ examined the card closely. He carefully peels the back of the card to reveal a clear sheet of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Aha, a “window”! (off DJ’s look) She hadn’t figured it out yet.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yes I had. Kate smacks Daffy on the back of the head, sending him flying out of frame. DJ holds the viewer in front of the painting and a glowing 15th century map of Africa appears.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Wow. Daffy bounces back into frame and proclaims:

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Now all we have to do is steal the Mona Lisa! A couple of BORED FRENCH GUARDS turn when they hear this, but decide it’s nothing, and return to their ennui. Bugs looks through the filter.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: We could take a picture through that window thingy...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Yeah! Use your spy phone! DJ examines the spy phone.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: It doesn’t seem to have a camera... Maybe... DJ pushes a button. Liquid squirts out and hits Daffy in the face. His bill melts off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, that just shoots acid... She brandishes her cellphone, points to the camera lens.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (playful) Spy phone without a camera? Loser. Bugs holds up the filter for Kate. She takes the camera- phone and snaps a picture of the map.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll take that. They turn. Elmer Fudd has a shotgun trained at them.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: What gives, doc? We’ve made a hundred pictures together. I've loaned you money. I helped hook up your stereo.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: Well, as it turns out, I’m secretly evil.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: That’s show biz for you.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: Now make with the camera so I can please my dark masters. Bugs goes into a fast street magician patter.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Queen of diamonds is your card! Just put it back into the pack. Anywhere is fine. Bugs hands Elmer the card and fans out a deck. Elmer, confused, puts the Queen into the deck. Bugs does a couple of fancy shuffles, including one that back and forth through Elmer’s head.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And upsie-daisey! Bugs throws the whole deck up in the air. He catches the first card which flutters down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This your card?

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: No. Bugs licks the card and slaps it on Elmer’s forehead. He proceeds to repeat this with a dozen other cards.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS /ELMER
dialogues.text: (blindingly fast) This? No./ This? No./ This? No. This? No./ This? No./ This? No. This? No./ This? No./ This? No. This? No./ This? No./ This? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmer's face is completely covered with cards. Bugs catches one last card, which we see is the card. He grabs Daffy’s hand and takes off o.s.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Kate) Come on! DJ and Kate slink away.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: It’s the Ace of Diamonds, I tell you. After a beat, Elmer realizes he’s been had. He shakes off the cards angrily.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ew. I’m gonna blast that rabbit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmer sees Daffy and Bugs run right into Dali's "Persistence of Memory." Elmer runs in after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The characters run across the surrealistic landscape. Elmer raises his gun to shoot, but the barrel droops and the bullets PLOP out. Bugs and Daffy run out the side of the painting. PAN the gallery wall to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daffy and Bugs run toward the foreground, SCREAMING in the style of the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugs and Daffy jump out of the painting (still drawn in Expressionistic style) race across the gallery, and jump into Toulouse-Lautrec's "At The Moulin Rouge." Elmer jumps out of "The Scream," shakes off his Munchian interpretation, and looks around. Suddenly, Bugs and Daffy come dancing out of "Moulin Rouge" as a couple of high-kicking Can-Can girls. Elmer is intrigued. Bugs and Daffy kick him in ass and face, turn and raise their skirts at him, then disappear into another frame. Enraged, Elmer follows them into  171 172 173 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escher-like Bugs and Daffy run up and down, over, upside- down the endless staircase with Elmer in pursuit, BLASTING his shotgun. The BLASTS leave his muzzle, but come out of random places in the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ and Kate stop behind a corner. DJ looks off in the direction they just came from.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go back and help them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Nah. Elmer never gets Bugs. It’s a formula, but it works. A huge hand reaches in from o.s. and covers Kate’s mouth with a handkerchief. She looks briefly alarmed, then passes out. The hand pulls her out of frame. DJ, looking in the other direction, doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: That’s the great thing about movies. You always know what’s going to happen. For example, if this was a movie, you and I would definitely end up together. DJ glances back to gauge her response. She isn’t there. He turns around.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kate? He sees Mr. Smith, carrying Kate over his shoulder, entering an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELEVATOR 173
dialogues.text: The other riders avert their eyes and make room for Mr. Smith and his unconscious quarry.  174 175 176 177 77.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELEVATOR, GROUND FLOOR 174
dialogues.text: The doors open and Mr. Smith exits. He takes off toward the door. The other riders exit, as if nothing had happened. A beat later, DJ runs into the frame, having apparently run down the stairs. He looks, and runs in the direction Mr. Smith exited. EXT. LOUVRE — DAY 175 DJ runs out onto the steps, just in time to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A French cabbie is helping the Mr. Smith stuff Kate in the trunk. They get in and zoom off a second before DJ arrives. He looks around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Gendarme! PEPE LE PEW, in police uniform, pulls up on a scooter.

dialogues.speaker: PEPE
dialogues.text: You have policing needs?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (pointing) There’s an unconscious woman in the trunk of that cab!

dialogues.speaker: PEPE
dialogues.text: Alors! This is my lucky day, is it not? DJ moves to climb on the scooter, but Pepe zips off frame without him.

dialogues.speaker: SEURAT'S PAINTING "SUNDAY AFTERNOON ON THE ISLAND OF LA
dialogues.text: GRANDE JATTE" hangs on the wall.  178 179 180 181 182 78.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDE JATTE
dialogues.text: Elmer chases Bugs and Daffy through the Pointillist masterpiece, BLASTING away. Park patrons run off ina panic. Everything Elmer hits explodes into a cloud of dots. Bugs and Daffy jump out of the painting. Elmer follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmer looks around, still Pointillist. One way, nothing. Another, nothing. One more turn: Bugs stands there with an electric fan.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Pointillism. A technique of using individual dots of pigment which, taken together, make an image.

dialogues.speaker: ELMER
dialogues.text: Crimeny. The fan blows Elmer away in a swirl of dots. Bugs turns to Daffy, who's smearing his dots together with a thumb.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: I think when you go to the movies, you should learn something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabbie is helping Mr. Smith with Kate. Mr. Smith pays him and trots toward the tower. A moment later, DJ runs up, very out of breath. He sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith, and the unconscious Kate, takes the elevator to the Observation deck. DJ also sees a black helicopter, approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s no time. Then DJ remembers: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: The pants! He pushes a button at the top of the fly of ROCKET FLAMES shoot out of the back pockets DJ squats, ready to take off. The pants rip into the sky. DJ is left squatting in boxer

dialogues.speaker: 78A.
dialogues.text: 182 the pants. on the pants. off and fly shorts. Several tourists wait to go up the tower. DJ, in his boxers, strolls in, whistling. The elevator doors close.  183 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith holds Kate under his arm like a package. A helicopter lowers into view. It is flown by BLACK JACQUES SHELLAC. Mr. Smith takes the camera from around Kate’s neck and pockets it. He reaches out for a ladder lowered from the helicopter. A hand taps his shoulder. Mr. Smith turns around. DJ throws a punch. The punch stops abruptly at Mr. Smith’s jaw with a CLANG. Mr. Smith retaliates with a series of kicks and punches, all executed with an unconscious Kate under his arm. He knocks DJ down, and returns to the awaiting helicopter. Kate awakens in time to see she the preciptious drop to the ground. She struggles. Mr. Smith seems annoyed, but reaches for the helicopter ladder. A metal replica of the Eifel Tower hits him in the back of the head. He turns to see that: DJ is buying one model after another from a SALESGIRL and hurling them at him. Mr. Smith bats off the metal models like flies.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (shouting) Give me the girl! She’s not worth it. She can be extremely annoying. Kate looks mad. Mr. Smith shrugs. He grabs onto the helicopter ladder and flies off, dropping Kate. DJ immediately swan dives off the Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate hurtles to her death, screaming through the tape. DJ falls through the air. He takes out his cell phone. Kate still hurtles, still screams. DJ pushes a button on the cell phone. The display reads, “Rappelling Line Activated”. A line shoots out at high speed. The line wraps around the girder and locks into shape. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate hurtles, screams. DJ swings down in a dramatic arc around the tower and grabs Kate out of thin air. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ swings with Kate held close. She looks at him with something more than just gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLOWER GIRL stands with a bouquet of roses. DJ and Kate swing through frame and the roses disappear and money appears in the girl’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: DJ AND KATE
dialogues.text: Continue swinging. She loves the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CANDY MAN sells chocolates. DJ and Kate swing through frame and a large box disappears from his stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cafe is called “PASSE D’ JO.” Daffy and Bugs sit at a table, looking impatient. Kate and DJ drop out of the sky and into their chairs. The ropes fall off Kate; she casually removes her gag. DJ puts the flowers and chocolates down and begins the scene grimly, as if nothing strange had just happened.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Okay, they’ve got the camera, which means they’1l have the map once they develop the picture.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, the great thing is you don’t have to develop it. It’s digital, so you just- (catches herself) Right.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: We still got that window thingy. We can take another picture.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (mad at self) My Dad wouldn’t have screwed this up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (comforting) But that’s what makes you you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: One thing your father would never have done is given up.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You don’t know my father.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: But I’ve seen all his movies. DJ stands, determined.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: You're right. Let’s go. Kate and Bugs also stand, determined. They all exit. Daffy follows.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (excited) We’re going to a Damian Drake movie? The waiter walks up.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Pas de gratui? Seulmont pour ca, nous allons jamais repayer notre debt de la guerre! Subtitle: “No Tip? Just for that, we will never repay our war debt!” PAN UP from the cafe to reveal that the Paris Skyline has an ACME tower identical to the one in Los Angeles, except there is an accent over the “E.” INT. ACME BUILDING - BOARDROOM — AFTERNOON 186 Mr. Smith plugs the phone/camera into the console next to Mr. Chairman, who pets a large cow’s liver.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Friends, I reveal to you the whereabouts of the Blue Monkey. Mr. Chairman pushes a button on a remote. The video screen shows the picture Kate took before the dais. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It shows an exquisite 15th century map of Africa, on the left half. On the right half is Daffy staring into the camera. Mr. Chairman angrily throws the remote at the video screen. It makes a breaking sound, a little smoke comes out, and it goes up into the ceiling. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) How can I be expected to run a multinational evil corporation with such incompetence?!

dialogues.speaker: V.P., NOT KEEP MOUTH SHUT
dialogues.text: Is that a rhetorical question? Mr. Chairman pushes a button. The V.P. is quickly wrapped in saran wrap. He struggles for a moment and stops.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: We can not allow some boy and girl and duck and rabbit to thwart our plan for global domination!

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wanna bet? Damian is suspended in a harness and covered with hundreds of electrodes. The mad scientist from earlier operates a small box that appears to allow him to control the movements of Damian, who is moving somewhat like an ultimate fighter in a video game. Mr. Chairman takes the box from the mad scientist.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: A wager?

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: Five dollars says my son scuttles your diabolical plan and saves the world.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: You’re on. Mr. Chairman manipulates the knobs on the small box and Damian starts smacking himself squarely on the face. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) Stop hitting yourself. Stop hitting yourself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Satisfied, Mr. Chairman turns away from Damian.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (evil smile) I believe I will hedge my bet. Let us unleash our most vicious operative. He pushes a button on a remote. Nothing happens. Annoyed, he goes over to his other remotes, picks up a different remote, and pushes a button. Nothing happens. The Vice President next to the remotes, meekly suggests a third remote. He angrily grabs it away and pushes a button. A metal cage is lowered from the ceiling. It contains the TASMANIAN DEVIL.

dialogues.speaker: TASMANIAN DEVIL
dialogues.text: <Tasmanian Devil Noises>

dialogues.speaker: V.P., NEVER LEARNING
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman, I agree, the Tasmanian Devil is quite vicious. But if memory serves, he’s also extremely stupid. Mr. Chairman pushes a button. Taz’s cage opens. He spins out. We hear GNARLING and GNASHING. Taz spins back into his cage, licking his lips. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The V.P. is a skeleton. SKELETON V.P. I withdraw my objection.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAP OF THE BLUE MONKEY
dialogues.text: On a nice matte finish. The map is lowered to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, in sweat-drenched safari gear, stands in a clearing. He points his machete at some dense foliage.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: It’s another six-thousand cubits in the... thick direction. Kate, Bugs and Daffy are clearly not up for that.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! If the bad guys get the diamond, they’1l plunge the earth into an endless night of evil, and only one of us wants that! Kate shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not you. I meant Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) True. It’s basically win-win for me. In the distance, a funnel cloud made of foliage springs up. A DISTANT GNASHING can be heard. As our guys watch, trees fall like dominoes. Then animals flee toward us as if a lion were attacking. Whatever it is, it's getting closer! A tree topples directly in front of our people; it trunk is then RAZORED in two by something moving too fast to make out. The tiny tornado stops: it's the TASMANIAN DEVIL.

dialogues.speaker: TASMANIAN DEVIL
dialogues.text: <Threatening sounds>

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re another one of those nasty henchmen, aren’t you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TASMANIAN DEVIL
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. Taz begins to slobber viciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugs transforms into a delicious roast rabbit. Daffy transforms into a delicious baked ham. DJ transforms into a giant hot dog. Kate transforms into a chocolate eclair.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Drooling Taz approaches, affixing a napkin to his neck. DJ gets an idea. He pulls the Proboscinator from his pocket, surreptitiously activating. He holds the nose aloft, and waves it around. (Smell lines radiate).

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Here, boy! You want a treat, boy? Taz zooms up, like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit, boy. Beg. Roll over. Back flip. Taz does all these in quick succession. DJ drops the nose into Taz’s mouth. Taz gobbles it like a dog, licks his lips, then turns back to them. Taz takes two steps forward, then looks puzzled. Smell lines radiate from his body. As he looks down, his body transforms into a delicious roast...

dialogues.speaker: TASMANIAN DEVIL
dialogues.text: Chicken! Taz quickly gobbles himself, leaving only his mouth. The mouth hangs in the air for a moment, chagrined. The mouth drops to the ground and runs off into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: TASMANIAN DEVIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yipe yipe yipe yipe yipe... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Okay then. Let’s get back to hacking! Daffy, Kate and Bugs SIGH deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vegetation breaks away as DJ chops through it. Behind him the other weakly swing their machetes, chopping nothing. Daffy accidently lops off Bugs’ tail.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Sorry, old chap. Bugs slaps his tail back on. Kate slumps to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I can’t go any further.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (even more exhausted) And I’m not leaving her here. Suddenly, we hear a great CRASHING AND THRASHING. Everyone turns in alarm. A HUGE ELEPHANT bursts through the underbrush. It snorts ferociously! Our heroes recoil!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bad elephant! It’s TWEETY, who swings in a cage on the elephant’s head.

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: You almost stepped on those people! On the elephant’s back is GRANNY, in safari gear, with SYLVESTER curled up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY
dialogues.text: Little Damien! How funny seeing you here! You look exhausted, dear. Would you like a lift? Daffy is already sitting behind Granny. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Giddyap!

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: It sure was a lucky coincidence, you showing up just now.

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY
dialogues.text: (odd little smile) Yes, wasn’t it? We hear a FOREBODING FORESHADOWING STING. The characters look around, wondering where that came from.
The fully loaded elephant trudges past several scenic vistas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The characters are jarred from their lumbering by a BEAUTIFUL CHORUS OF TWEETING. Everybody looks and sees:

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE TREE
dialogues.text: Filled with Tweety Birds of every color and hue (Well, six or seven anyway.)

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: Looks in awe.

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: I’ve discovered my roots!

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER
dialogues.text: I’ve discovered my dinner!

dialogues.speaker: MULTI-COLORED TWEETYS, (UNISON)
dialogues.text: <Bantu translation to come> SUBTITLE: “I taught I taw a puddy tat!” Sylvester crouches to leap. He is instantly covered by dozens on Tweetys. They fly off, leaving him bloody and furless. Tweety raises his fist in triumph. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: Cry freedom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the elephant crests a hill or pushes through some vegetation to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elephant brings the crew into a giant stone plaza, surrounded by giant stone monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Looks like this is our stop. They dismount. DJ pulls out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: Oh, you put your money away.

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY
dialogues.text: It was our pleasure. Enjoy the rest of your adventure! The elephant turns and exits. DJ puts his arm around Kate and they gaze into a tall ancient corridor leading up to a stone monkey altar bathed in blue light. Daffy dashes past them.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: It’s mine! All mine! DJ manages to grab Daffy by the tail feathers. He holds him upside down and shows him: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A DISNEY-STYLE SIGN
dialogues.text: Reading "GAUNTLET OF DEATH." A smaller sign reads, "You must be at least this tall to die horribly." They look closer at the walls of the corridor. They're covered with horrific visages, gargoyles...and a duck skull. In the distance, a volcano RUMBLES. Nearby, lava tubes emerge from the ground, spouting flames. DAFFY (CONT’D) (still upside down) You know, I hadn’t noticed that. DJ drops Daffy to the ground. He picks up a coconut and throws it in the gauntlet. Before it can even land, a primitive trap springs up, impaling it. Coconut milk spurts out like blood.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Well, that explains all the skeletons. And most of the coconuts. DJ, dead serious, heads toward the gauntlet.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: DJ, what are you, a maniac?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: I’m a trained maniac. Proceeding with precision and grace, DJ negotiates a series of traps without activating them, including darts set to cloud the air with needles; spikes driven upward from the grass...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (impatient) For crying out loud, time is moolah! Get the lead out! Daffy claps like a baseball coach. Kate grabs his hands and squeezes them hard. DJ treads carefully through some poisonous snakes... DAFFY (CONT’D) (desperate) C’mon, move it! My greed needs to be slaked! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (very evenly) Relax. This is going to take a few more hours...

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: A few more hours?! Forget that, Mister! Daffy marches into the gauntlet. He immediately starts setting off the traps.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER ACTION-PACKED SEQUENCE 192
dialogues.text: DJ and Daffy proceed through the gauntlet in tandem, with one important difference: while DJ artfully and amazingly dodges each deadly blow, Daffy takes the full brunt of each punishment. DJ deflects/catches dozens of deadly darts; Daffy is multiply pierced. DJ flips over a pit; Daffy falls in and crawls out covered with scorpions. DJ runs up the wall to avoid flames shooting from the mouths of stone monkey reliefs. Daffy staggers out of the flames, a cinder with eyes. DJ leaps backwards, as if high jumping, between two slicing scimitars. The scimitars slice Daffy into four pieces, each piece is swallowed by a separate snapping Venus Flytrap. A flytrap comes for DJ; he punches it and knocks it unconscious. A few feet ahead, Daffy grows out of the ground as a sheepish Daffy Daisy. DJ “picks” Daffy and charges forward, barely missing various arrows, boulders, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, stands at the other end of gauntlet, exhausted. Bugs and Kate walk up past the already tripped traps.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: (applauding) Bravo! Bravo!

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: It’s what I do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate bends over to address the destroyed Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (genuine laughing) And you were pretty funny.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: (standing, woozy) It’s what I do. Bugs comes up behind Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: BUGS
dialogues.text: Nobody takes a deadly blow more hilariously than Daffy Duck. Bugs pats Daffy’s shoulder. Daffy’s arm falls off. DJ approaches the blue glow. A pedestal. Daffy zips in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Hello, wealth and (voice dropping) power. It's a small blue monkey-shaped stone on a stone ring. Daffy picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the Blue Monkey?! This dime store bauble? I’ve been rooked. Grifted by the gods! Daffy raises his arms heavenward.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I demand recompense. Where’s my humongous gem? Kate plucks the ring from Daffy’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wait a second. This is a Tessella. Everyone stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (explaining) A mosaic piece, identical interlocking shapes which form a pattern, first used in Ancient Mesopotamia. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They still stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, I don’t have an IQ of 106. (points) Plus I noticed there was a piece missing from this one. She points to a large tessellation on the wall (or floor?) made of identical monkey shapes and forming one large monkey shape. Kate puts on the ring and inserts the monkey in an empty space in the center of the mosaic. With an ANCIENT CREAKING SOUND the monkey-shaped mosaic emerges from the wall. Kate is taken aback momentarily. On a hunch, she turns her fist. The monkey ring turns the monkey mosaic like a key; it rotates clockwise. The ground TREMBLES. Everyone turns in half-horror to see what happens next. In front of them, a spectacular achievement in set direction unfolds. The wall behind the pedestal lowers down, forming a bridge across a molten lava moat to: EXT. MONKEY ALTAR — CONTINUOUS 194 It's really something. You should see the drawings. They stare in awe. Daffy zips past them.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: I’m rich! I’m affluent! My liquidity is assured! Daffy races up the side of altar and runs toward the Buddha monkey. He dives for the diamond. Daffy stops in mid-air, inches from the Blue Monkey. DJ is holding Daffy perpendicular by the legs.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: If you don’t mind. Daffy droops down and DJ drops him. As he gets up:

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Mind? I was just poisoned, burnt, chopped and eaten for that diamond. Why should I mind? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ stands before the diamond, solemnly. He removes it from the statue’s hands. Its facets are cut in such a way that the slightly bluish face of a monkey appears in the center of it. DJ holds the diamond aloft.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: This is for you, Dad. Sunlight hits the diamond. It glows. Light gathers in the eyes of the monkey inside and a BLUE BEAM shoots out. DJ is engulfed in a field of blue energy. In seconds we watch as he DE-EVOLVES BEFORE OUR EYES. He goes from DJ to Airheads to George of the Jungle to Encino Man to Cro- Magnon until finally the beam stops - leaving hima MONKEY. The Monkey gives a SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Why, DJ, why? Why you? Why wasn't it me?! Just academic curiosity, you understand. Daffy picks up the diamond again, this time backwards. He notices from this side there seems to be a reddish human face inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: <greedy chuckle> Sunlight hits the diamond, sending out a RED BEAM. RED energy engulfs the monkey. We watch as DJ RE-EVOLVES from monkey to caveman until once again he is DJ. Daffy drops the diamond and embraces DJ.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: DJ, Buddy! You're okay!

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That is so sweet. Everyone turns to see Granny and Sylvester. Granny stands with Sylvester. GRANNY (CONT’D) Now if you could hand over the diamond... Granny reaches under her chin and PEELS OFF HER FACE, revealing she is Mr. Chairman underneath. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Immediately. Sylvester pulls his mouth wide open and Mr. Smith's head emerges. He wiggles out of the disguise, growing in height and width as he does. Tweety, in his cage, is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: Hey, you're not Granny and Puddy- Tat! What have you done with them, you monsters!

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: <Evil laugh, then> We sent them on an all-expense paid ocean cruise.

dialogues.speaker: TWEETY
dialogues.text: Oh. That was very nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: The diamond, Mr. Drake...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: No, forget you. You’re evil.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: I see. Well then... Mr. Smith appears, carrying Damian over his shoulders. DJ’s father is wrapped in chains and locks.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith, throw Damian Drake in the lava, please. Mr. Smith raises Damian over his head.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: (distraught ) No! You want the diamond? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: I believe I’ve already said I wanted the diamond. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ approaches Mr. Chairman. Damian crunches a ball gag in his mouth and spits it out.

dialogues.speaker: DAMIAN
dialogues.text: Don’t do it, son! That’s diamond’s more important than I am!

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Not to me. DJ walks toward Mr. Chairman with the diamond, but at the last moment he holds it aloft and points it his father. A blue light envelopes Damian Drake. He quickly devolves into a monkey. A much smaller monkey. He escapes his chains and scampers off, EEPING.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run, Dad, run! Mr. Smith comes after DJ. DJ turns and tosses the diamond to:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Got it! Kate catches the diamond, but the sun hits it. A blue beam lances Bugs. He changes into the fluffy-tailed, goofy-looking Tex Avery Bugs Bunny circa 1938. The transformation causes a startled Kate to stumble; she lets the diamond fly. Right to Mr. Chairman.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (chuckle) Come to evil papa... Just then Daffy flies in front of Mr. Chairman and nabs the diamond.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY
dialogues.text: Interception! A victorious Daffy flies through the air.

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once again, Daffy Duck has- A blue beam shoots from the stone and strikes Bugs and Kate: he's now transformed into the Neanderthal rabbit from "Mad as a Mars Hare;" she looks the same but is wearing a cavewoman outfit, a la “1 Million Years B.C.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Looking down) Oopsie... Oh, well, can’t make an omelette without breaking a few- CRACK. Daffy hits a stone idol. He drops down, unconscious, and the diamond rolls away.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: is punching Mr. Smith in the face. CLANG! CLANG! Mr. Smith is unfazed by the blows, but is bothered by the angry monkey on his head. The diamond rolls past them. DJ looks and sees that it is rolling toward:

dialogues.speaker: THE LAVA PIT
dialogues.text: With lots of hot lava in it.

dialogues.speaker: MONKEY DAMIAN
dialogues.text: Stops hitting Mr. Smith and looks at DJ, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Oh, right. You’re still a monkey. DJ runs after the diamond. Too late! It rolls off the side. DJ dives! He catches the diamond and goes over the side with it. Everyone rushes to look over the side.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE LAVA PIT
dialogues.text: DJ clings to a rock by one hand, the diamond crooked in his other arm. Cave Kate reaches down for him.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE KATE
dialogues.text: <concerned grunting> Monkey Damien, Neanderthal Bugs, and Daffy also look distressed. Mr Chairman and Mr. Smith smile. Mr. Smith extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Your life for the diamond, Mr. Drake?

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Let me think about it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DJ’s hand slips. We see that with his other hand he is operating the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: DJ pushes a button. The screen reads, “ELECTROMAGNET ON.” DJ is suddenly lifted up into the air, cell phone leading the way. It’s headed right for: MR. SMITH’S FACE The cell phone attaches to his cheek with a CLANG. Mr. Smith reels backward, taking DJ with him. DJ releases the phone, which remains stuck to Mr. Smith’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Iron jaw. I suspected as much. Cave Kate sidles up next to DJ, AFFECTIONATELY GRUNTING, and starts grooming him. DJ tries to ignore this.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Very clever. Now the diamond. (hand out) Gimme.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: What? So you can turn everyone in the world into monkeys?

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Don’t be ridiculous. We are going to use the diamond's power to super-evolve ourselves, placing us above all others and giving us an unbeatable edge in a tight marketplace. (shrugs) We may turn some people into monkeys. (turning) Mr. Smith, dismantle him. Mr. Smith starts to advance on DJ, who is trapped against the edge of the chasm. He looks to Daffy. He’s sleeping peacefully, diamonds circling his head. Neanderthal Bugs is digging a hole. Cave Kate is picking insects off of Neanderthal Bugs. Monkey Damien raises his hands in a what-can-I-do gesture. Mr. Smith is getting close... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith drops his guard, walks to a nearby tree on which is a time clock like the one we saw at Acme headquarters, and punches out. MR. CHAIRMAN (CONT’D) What are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: MR. SMITH
dialogues.text: I gotta have an eight-hour turnaround between shifts. Howard? The elephant ambles over to join his colleague.

dialogues.speaker: ELEPHANT
dialogues.text: I could go for a cold one.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: You can’t leave now!

dialogues.speaker: MR. SMITH
dialogues.text: Take it up with the Teamsters.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (backing off) No, no, it needn’t come to that. Mr. Smith (the cell phone still attached to his face) and the elephant walk away. Mr. Chairman turns back to DJ, annoyed.
